Title: Junior - Data Analyst - Milano/Cagliari
Description:
Junior - Data Analyst Milano/Cagliari

Sei pronto a #MakeAnImpactThatMatters nel nostro team Audit & Assurance?

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Data Analytics Audit&Assurance avrai l‚Äôoccasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe pi√π esperti, sarai responsabile delle attivit√† progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualit√† del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorit√†, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.

Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realt√† leader nel settore.

#YourRole

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilit√† di imparare dai colleghi pi√π Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.

In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di


Raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti, mediante l‚Äôutilizzo di strumenti quali Excel, SQL, Python.
Sviluppare report e dashboard tramite i principali tool di BI (es. PowerBI, Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud,‚Ä¶).
Supportare nell‚Äôorganizzazione e gestione dei dataset su database relazionali e NoSQL.
Analizzare, interpretare dati e fornire insights per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali


Grazie all‚Äôufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attivit√† di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

#WinningRequirements


Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science
Competenze di base in analisi dei dati, statistiche e metodologie di data mining
Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come Excel, SQL
Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione per l'analisi dei dati (es. Python, R)
Spiccate capacit√† analitiche e attitudine al problem-solving
Propensione al lavoro in team
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Disponibilit√† a viaggiare in Italia e all‚Äôestero


#NiceToHave


Esperienza su strumenti quali SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, PowerPlatform
Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di machine learning, deep learning e NLP
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di librerie di machine learning come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.


#LoveWorkingAtDeloitteIf


Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d‚Äôordine √®: crescita
L‚Äôidea di trasformare un problema in opportunit√† ti stimola
Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d‚Äôinsieme, tenendo sempre a mente l‚Äôoperativit√† per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrit√† e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorit√† possono cambiare quotidianamente
Ami lavorare in team


Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano o Cagliari

Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva

#MakeanImpactThatMatters

Deloitte √® un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Strategy, Risk & Transaction Advisory, Tax & Legal e Technology & Transformation. Il nostro obiettivo √® supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilit√† √® un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualit√† legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la societ√†. Scopri di pi√π sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinch√© siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un‚Äôorganizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all‚Äôinterno e all‚Äôesterno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.

Se vuoi scoprire come sar√† il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio √® stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell‚Äôinclusivit√†.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At Scalapay, we‚Äôre shaping a culture with high standards, independent and critical thought, innovation, ownership, and continuous learning. We operate in a fast-moving, tech-driven environment, and we‚Äôre looking for people who thrive in change, think boldly, and take initiative.

If you‚Äôre ready to put your potential to the test in a hiring process designed to spotlight exceptional talent, this is your chance to stand out and grow with one of Europe‚Äôs most ambitious fintech teams.

#MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.

You will:

  • Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support;
  • Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement;
  • Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making;
  • Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights;
  • Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data;
  • Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes;
  • Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation;
  • Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay;
  • Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.

You‚Äôll be great for this role if:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech;
  • You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus;
  • You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling;
  • You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses;
  • You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way;
  • You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas;
  • You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!

Why you should join Scalapay:

  • Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base);
  • International environment with significant challenges to be met every day;
  • Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences;
  • Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
  • Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.

Recruitment Process:

  • Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team;
  • Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role;
  • Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders;
  • Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.

Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
SEND YOUR CV FOR EXPLORATORY INTERVIEWS - WE ARE LOOKING FOR OUR COLLEAGUES OF TOMORROW!

Data Analytics ‚Äì Corporate ‚Äì Milan

Hello, we‚Äôre L‚ÄôOr√©al.

We're not just building brands; we're shaping how the world experiences beauty (and it takes a lot of cool jobs to do it). Intrigued? Keep reading‚Äîthis might be the opportunity you‚Äôve been searching for.

A Day in the Life

As part of our Italian Data Analytics team, reporting to the Data Director, you‚Äôll play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. Collaborating with the Europe Data Team and local divisions and stakeholders, you‚Äôll work on exciting projects that combine innovation, analytics, and business impact.

Here‚Äôs What Your Day-to-day Might Look Like


Analytics Solution Development: Analyze functional requirements, develop technical specifications, and create analytics solutions, including MVPs and POCs.
Ad Hoc Analytics: Conduct in-depth data analysis, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights to cross-functional teams.
Project Management: Define business cases, monitor KPIs, and manage project plans and budgets.
Continuous Improvement: Stay ahead of analytics trends and share knowledge within the team.
Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy and maintain high-quality documentation.


You‚Äôll Thrive In This Role If You


Have expertise in data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Are skilled in statistical methods and have a strong attention to detail.
Excel in communication and presentation, making complex data accessible to all.
Are passionate about using data to drive business impact.
Speak fluent Italian and English and hold a Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field.


What‚Äôs In It For You


A place for you to leave your comfort zone and grow beyond your potential (here, you‚Äôll be encouraged to try new things and take risks!).
Real responsibility from day 1‚Äîthere‚Äôs no sitting on the sidelines at L‚ÄôOr√©al.
An environment where people of every ethnicity, social background, age, religion, gender, and sexual orientation and disabilities are accepted, can speak up, will thrive, and are celebrated!
A place where you can contribute to something bigger! Many of our brands have societal/environmental causes to make a concrete difference.


Who We Are

L‚ÄôOr√©al is present in 150 markets on five continents. For more than a century, L‚ÄôOr√©al has devoted itself solely to ‚ÄòCreate beauty that moves the world‚Äô; it is now the industry world leader with ‚Ç¨42 billion consolidated sales. Together, we solve complex challenges at scale while making sure we stay committed to making the world a more inclusive and a better place for everyone & our planet.

We‚Äôre committed to guaranteeing inclusive recruitment processes and to advocating for hiring and promoting each candidate in an ethical and equitable way. The Group strictly prohibits discrimination against any applicant for employment because of the individual‚Äôs gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, visible and/or invisible disabilities, socio-economic and/or multicultural origins, health conditions, age, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa brillante e motivata da inserire all'interno dell'Ufficio Business Data & Project CQ della Direzione Centrale Commerciale.




La risorsa sar√† coinvolta in attivit√† di analisi finanziarie e non, con particolare attenzione alla redditivit√† del prodotto cessione del quinto, supportando le decisioni strategiche attraverso la lettura e l‚Äôinterpretazione di dati complessi.




Il/la candidato/a ideale √® laureato/a in Economia, Statistica/Matematica o Ingegneria Gestionale, con una solida preparazione in matematica finanziaria, consolidata conoscenza di strumenti quantitativi per data exploration, analisi statistica e data visualization e vanta un'esperienza lavorativa di circa 3 anni, preferibilmente nel mercato del credito al consumo.

Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza del prodotto cessione del quinto.




Il ruolo richiede una spiccata attitudine analitica e precisione, unite a proattivit√†, affidabilit√† e capacit√† organizzative.




Sono fondamentali competenze nella gestione e interpretazione dei dati, dalla fase di estrazione da archivi complessi fino alla realizzazione di analisi qualitative e quantitative, reportistica direzionale e dashboard.




La capacit√† di rappresentare in modo chiaro ed efficace informazioni complesse, interfacciandosi con diverse tipologie di interlocutori, √® considerata essenziale.




√à richiesta buona conoscenza di SAS o, in alternativa, di linguaggi e ambienti di analisi dati come SQL, Python, R, Stata, SPSS o Matlab, oltre a un utilizzo avanzato di Excel e alla padronanza di PowerPoint.




Sede di lavoro: Milano.







Per le aziende del Gruppo Mediobanca la diversit√† e l‚Äôinclusivit√† sono valori fondamentali. Le persone interessate verranno considerate nel rispetto della diversit√†, valorizzando differenti caratteristiche di et√†, cultura, abilit√† e orientamento o espressione di genere.

Title: Junior - Data Analyst
Description:
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilit√†

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse

Il Digital Assurance Team √® un team all‚Äôavanguardia di KPMG in cui diverse competenze collaborano per dare forma alla digitalizzazione del futuro dei servizi di assurance e revisione contabile. A vrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di lavorare a fianco di revisori esperti sviluppando, attraverso la formazione interna ma soprattutto il training on the job, la capacit√† di analizzare criticamente i processi aziendali a supporto dell‚Äôinformativa finanziaria e i dati elaborati dai sistemi informativi delle societ√† identificando elementi di anomalia ed interpretando le dinamiche alla base dei trend economico-finanziari.

Starting date: Settembre 2025

Tipologia di inserimento: Apprendistato

Ufficio: Milano

Nello specifico ti occuperai di:


Sviluppo di soluzioni di analytics a supporto dei team di audit (transactional analytics, dashboard di analisi di dati contabili, process mining, KPI di processo, ecc)
Sviluppo di tecniche di revisione basate sull‚Äôutilizzo di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative
Supporto ai team nell‚Äôutilizzo delle soluzioni proposte
Cura di eventi di comunicazione volti a far conoscere il progetto / le soluzioni


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:


Hai una formazione di base economico-contabile
Hai spiccato interesse per l‚Äôarea del reporting finanziario e per i data analytics
Hai voglia di imparare e metterti in gioco
Vuoi crescere all‚Äôinterno di un Network Internazionale


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L‚ÄôOpen Banking √® il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 √® una realt√† indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo √® diventare una data driven company!

Responsabilit√†:

Analizzerai grandi quantit√† di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai l‚Äôindividuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite l‚Äôimplementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Ottima conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacit√† relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacit√† analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione √® importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
Attivit√† di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito

Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CHI SIAMO?




IDATA GROUP √® un System Integrator, nato nel 1979 e da oltre 40 anni lavora a supporto delle aziende in Italia e all‚Äô Estero.

Grazie alle competenze acquisite negli anni, offriamo servizi di:

Sviluppo software, web, mobile, embedded, IOT
Cloud
Cybersecurity: PT, WAPT, VA, Digital Identity, DLP, Data Protection, Governance, Corporate Security
Data Analysis e Data Engineering
Business Intelligence
Sistemi GIS
Project Management e Integrazione di sistemi Innovativi







CHE RUOLO TI PROPONIAMO?




Data Analyst




Sei alla ricerca di un team dove poter condividere le tue idee, crescere professionalmente e mettere in pratica la tua passione per l'analisi dei dati e la Business Intelligence?

Perfetto, sei nel posto giusto!

Lavorando con noi come Data Analyst, collaborerai con un team che segue progetti internazionali e innovativi, proponendo e realizzando soluzioni di Business Intelligence con diversi strumenti, tra cui Power BI, QlikView, QlikSense e altri tool di analisi.







COSA CERCHIAMO IN TE?

Conoscenza degli strumenti per la manipolazione, visualizzazione e analisi dei dati

Title: Analista dati
HTML:
Cosmico connette i Talenti dell‚Äôecosistema Tech e Digital con le opportunit√† professionali e le esperienze che gli permettono di crescere e valorizzare il proprio talento, attraverso la condivisione, sfide professionali, co-living e co-learning o pi√π semplicemente, ispirazione.


Siamo una start up e una community di talenti nel campo del Coding (sviluppo web e mobile), del Design (User Experience ed Interface, Graphic e Motion Design), del Marketing (Copywriting, Social Media Marketing, Art Direction) e del Strategy& Data (PM/PMO, Data Expert).


Lavoriamo al fianco delle principali societ√† di consulenza, grandi agenzie digitali, aziende multinazionali, start up e scale up.


Per uno dei principali gestori di fondi di venture capital in Italia, ricerchiamo un Data Analyst con competenze tecniche e finanziarie per supportare l'analisi degli investimenti in una societ√† innovativa e technology driven.


Responsabilit√† principali:

  • Integrazione e ottimizzazione di 8 servizi esterni specializzati, utilizzando strumenti di automazione come Zapier;
  • Analisi di mercato, studio dei competitor e identificazione di trend di settore per velocizzare i processi decisionali;
  • Costruzione di modelli quantitativi e automatizzazione di flussi di calcolo e analisi;
  • Elaborazione di report e dashboard per la valutazione delle performance degli investimenti;
  • Supporto nell'identificazione di opportunit√† di investimento nel settore tecnologico, con particolare attenzione all'AI.


Competenze richieste:

  • Solida conoscenza degli strumenti di analisi dati e capacit√† di interpretazione dei risultati;
  • Comprensione delle tecnologie emergenti, in particolare AI e relativi ambiti di applicazione;
  • Buona conoscenza del mondo finance e dei meccanismi di venture capital;
  • Capacit√† di lavorare in autonomia e di gestire progetti complessi;
  • Attitudine proattiva e orientamento ai risultati.


Dettagli progetto:

Impegno: Full-time;

Modalit√†: Ibrido (3-4 giorni a settimana) presso gli uffici di Milano.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About BizAway

Here at BizAway, we Deliver the Future of Travel. üòé

We are a solid international company with strong ambitions and great expertise. With a focus on sustainability üå±, on a daily basis we support companies enabling them to improve their travel management through our constantly evolving services and solutions, always characterized by our tech attitude and smart and innovative processes. üöÄ We know that success comes from People and deserves to be recognized.üë´Proactivity and

Reliability, Kind collaboration, and communication are the core values of our Solution Culture. If you like challenges and would love to be part of one of the fastest-growing B2B scale-ups, then BizAway is the company you have been looking for. ü§©

We are looking for

We are looking for a driven and enthusiastic Data Analyst (m/w/d) , who desires to contribute to the growth and success of our Data & Analytics Team.

Your role in BizAway


You manage and improve our current reporting system, supporting all internal needs for Data visualization of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to deliver value from data.
You learn all aspects of the travel industry from Product, Finance, Sales and Service/Operations perspective, translating data into actionable insights resulting in verifiable reporting.
By having domain expertise in our industry, you engage with Business and Strategy stakeholders to help define KPIs, including how data will be captured, shared, and leveraged across our departments.
You contribute to creating the base foundations of a comprehensive source of truth through data modeling actions.


Your Basic Qualifications


Previously worked in a Tech Company
Demonstrated experience with Product Analytics tools (e.g.: Amplitude, Mixpanel, Pendo, Google Analytics)
Demonstrated experience with BI Data Visualization tools (Qlik preferred)
Data analysis, presentation and visualization experience
Strong communication skills required
Ability to work alone or in a team as required
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Engineering, Economics or a related field is preferred
English proficiency (written and spoken level B2)


We are also interested in


Knowledge of programming languages such as Python
Experience with ETL tools
Understanding of AI/ML concepts


Our offer

‚úà A seat on a scale-up with skyrocketing growth

üí∞ Attractive Compensation, Including Equity In The Company

üìà Development of your entrepreneurial spirit, having the chance to implement real-impact

business decisions

üåç Multicultural and international team

üôå Collaborative and smart environment to work and learn

üè¢ Hybrid working policy, and great offices in Europe

BizAway guarantees equal employment opportunities for all individuals, in compliance with Art. 3 of the Italian Constitution, Legislative Decree 198/2006 (Equal Opportunities Code), Law 162/2021, and EU Directive 2006/54/EC. The selection process is open without any discrimination on the basis of gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, ethnic origin, personal beliefs, or religion. Candidates are invited to review the privacy notice pursuant to Art. 13 of EU Regulation 2016/679 and Legislative Decree 196/2003, as amended by Legislative Decree 101/2018.

Title: Intern Data Analyst
Description:
Chi siamo:

La nostra missione √® offrire ai nostri clienti vere e proprie esperienze culinarie attraverso il nostro sushi fresco, le nostre coloratissime poke, i nostri golosi dessert e tante specialit√† provenienti da ogni parte del mondo e preparate ogni giorno a mano dai nostri sushi chef.

Siamo Eat Happy Group, una multinazionale nata a Colonia che vanta oltre 2000 punti vendita tra Germania, Austria, Italia e Lussemburgo attraverso i marchi Eat Happy e Wakame.

Siamo presenti in Italia dal 2018, il nostro Head Quarter si trova a Milano e con grande passione gestiamo i nostri due brand:

Eat Happy: sushi corner all‚Äôinterno dei supermercati, dove i nostri chef preparano ogni giorno a mano del freschissimo sushi e le altre specialit√†, davanti agli occhi dei nostri clienti.

Wakame: in uno stabilimento di oltre 3000 metri quadri sito a Bologna, i nostri chef producono il nostro sushi e le nostre specialit√†, in modo artigianale. Da Bologna viene poi distribuito nei migliori supermercati e posizionato nelle nostre vetrine.

Per continuare l'espansione del nostro gruppo EatHappy in Italia stiamo cercando un:

Intern Data Analyst (m/f/o)

(Tirocinio curricolare o extracurricolare, Milano, Full time )

Lavorerai insieme al Team Finance e ti occuperai di:


Raccogliere, organizzare ed interpretare i dati commerciali dei POS tramite strumenti


di analisi qualitativa e quantitativa;


Monitoraggio costante dei KPI e delle performance dei POS;
Identificare possibili interventi sui processi di raccolta dati e sugli strumenti (algoritmo, powerBI, database) che possano ottimizzare le esigenze aziendali;
Elaborazione report periodici a supporto dell‚Äôarea vendite con analisi puntuale dei risultati di vendita
Inserimento delle vendite nei sistemi informativi aziendali
Analizza le performances dei prodotti all‚Äôinterno dei POS per migliorare i risultati
Analizzare e pianificare le previsioni di vendita dei POS, intervenendo in caso di anomalie


Valuteremo la tua candidatura solo se avrai le seguenti caratteristiche:


Laurea o percorso di studio in ambito economico
Conoscenza SQL
Conoscenza del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel)
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Capacit√† di lavorare sotto pressione e in un ambiente dal ritmo veloce
Dinamismo
Attenzione al dettaglio
Capacit√† di problem solving


Il profilo ideale sta intraprendendo un percorso di studi, o ha conseguito una laurea, in ambito matematico-statistico.

Se sei interessato a unirti al gruppo, non vediamo l'ora di ricevere il tuo CV!

Title: HR DATA ANALYST
HTML:
Azienda Trasporti Milanesi S.p.A.

Overview

ATM √® alla ricerca di professionisti appassionati ed innovativi per la nostra Direzione Risorse Umane.

Se desideri lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia e collaborare con un team dinamico, questa √® l'opportunit√† che fa per te.

Principali attivit√†

  • Raccolta, strutturazione, analisi e reporting dei processi e dei dati utili alla funzione Risorse Umane;
  • Utilizzo del sistema informativo per le esigenze di interazione, interrogazione, controllo, simulazione di interesse della funzione;
  • Elaborazione periodica della reportistica HR per le societ√† del Gruppo (forza, budget, assenteismo, straordinari, mobilit√† orizzontale/verticale, ecc.);
  • Analisi dati relativi al personale;
  • Sviluppo e monitoraggio di indicatori HR relativi al personale.

Requisiti richiesti

  • Laurea in ambito economico, informatico, statistico o affini;
  • Ottima dimestichezza dei programmi Office ed in particolare conoscenza avanzata di MS Excel, MS Access o altri sistemi di gestione dei dati;
  • Conoscenza moduli SAP HR - HCM;
  • Buona conoscenza di SQL, programmi utili per lo sviluppo di reportistica e creazione dashboard ad-hoc;
  • Capacit√† di gestire informazioni confidenziali in modo professionale;
  • Capacit√† di operare su scadenze predefinite mantenendo una forte attenzione al dettaglio e agli obiettivi;
  • Costituisce titolo preferenziale avere operato in ambito HR in aziende strutturate o avere una esperienza pregressa in ruolo analogo.

Cosa troverai

Formazione e Sviluppo: investiamo nella crescita professionale e nello sviluppo di competenze dei nostri colleghi, attraverso programmi di induction, formazione continua e iniziative di learning ad hoc proposte dal nostro Campus Formazione ATM.

Ambiente di Lavoro: operiamo in un settore dinamico e in forte cambiamento, che ci stimola a garantire e innovare un servizio fondamentale per la Citt√† di Milano e non solo! Promuoviamo un ambiente lavorativo ispirato dall‚Äôimpronta dei nostri valori: Passione, Cura, Inclusione, Innovazione e Sostenibilit√†.

Wellbeing: ‚ÄúNoi siamo ATM‚Äù, il programma che racchiude numerose iniziative di welfare aziendale, tra cui assistenza sanitaria integrativa, servizi di counseling, campagne di screening, piattaforma flexible benefit, oltre 250 convenzioni per beni di consumo, tempo libero, servizi finanziari e molto altro.

Modalit√† di lavoro: smart working, flessibilit√† di orario in ingresso e in uscita.

Opportunit√† di Carriera: studiamo percorsi di carriera per i nostri talenti, che si concretizzano in opportunit√† di crescita interna o di job rotation interdipartimentale.

__________________________________

Costituiscono inoltre titoli preferenziali il possesso dei requisiti di cui all'art. 1 o l'appartenenza alle categorie protette di cui all'art. 18 della legge 68/99.

Il rapporto di lavoro sar√† regolato dal R.D. 148/1931 e dal CCNL Autoferrotranvieri.

Title: DATA ANALYST & REPORTING
HTML:
Randstad Enterprise ricerca per prestigioso cliente del settore Logistica&trasporti una risorsa da inserire in Stage nella Direzione Operations come Data Analyst & Reporting presso Innovation Campus, Peschiera Borromeo (MI).


Si offre:

  • La possibilit√† di sviluppare capacit√† di analisi e sintesi dei dati numerici;
  • La possibilit√† di sperimentare le dinamiche organizzative di un network organizzato e orientato a supportare lo sviluppo del business lavorando sul miglioramento continuo;
  • Accrescere le tue competenze relazionali all'interno dell'organizzazione in un contesto multinazionale;
  • Stage di 6 mesi full time, con rimborso spese di ‚Ç¨ 800 lordi e ticket restaurant di ‚Ç¨ 7.50 (‚Ç¨ 7.00 in smart working);
  • Navetta aziendale da Milano (stazioni di Milano Rogoredo, Lambrate e Segrate).


Principali attivit√†:


  • Supporto nella raccolta, analisi, sintesi dei dati operativi volti a supportare le attivit√† quotidiane e le iniziative strategiche;
  • Creazione, mantenimento e monitoraggio della reportistica periodica per il team Operations e la direzione aziendale;
  • Supporto al team nella gestione e aggiornamento delle piattaforme in uso;
  • Supporto nel monitoraggio delle performance operative e nel fornire analisi dettagliate su vari KPI (Key Performance Indicators), come tempi di consegna, livelli di servizio e processo.


Profilo ricercato:


Si richiede forte interesse nell‚Äôapprofondire il mondo degli Analytics & Reporting, competenze di pianificazione e organizzazione, mindset analitico e passione per i dati e una buona conoscenza di Excel (livello avanzato), Power Point e lingua inglese (livello intermedio B2).


Experienze e skills:


  • Laurea triennale/specialistica
  • Teamwork e collaborazione
  • Verr√† considerate un plus la conoscenza di strumenti di Data Visualization (es. PowerBi)


La ricerca √® rivolta ai candidati ambosessi (L.903/77). Ti preghiamo di leggere l'informativa sulla privacy Randstad (https://www.randstad.it/privacy/) ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 sulla protezione dei dati (GDPR).

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About CoreView:




CoreView is the global leader in effortless Microsoft 365 (M365) security, governance, and administration. Trusted by Fortune 100 companies, we empower organizations to simplify complex M365 environments, strengthen security, and maximize ROI‚Äîwith over 20 million users managed worldwide.




Our unified, cloud-native platform delivers powerful automation, rapid value, and end-to-end visibility across the entire M365 ecosystem. Backed by world-class support and a collaborative, innovative culture, CoreView is a place where your ideas matter and your work truly impact global enterprises.




Job Summary:

We‚Äôre looking for a sharp, curious, and proactive Junior Data Analyst to play a crucial role in building and scaling the engine behind our fast-growing sales team. You will help develop and maintain dashboards, play a critical role in the reporting and calculation of sales commissions and work cross-functionally with sales, marketing and our customer success team.




Bachelor's degree in engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in Power BI (or other data visualization tools) and experience in creating and managing interactive dashboards.
Experience with Salesforce or other CRM platforms, including data extraction and analysis.
Strong SQL skills, with the ability to write complex queries.
Fluent in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong analytical skills and a keen attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Problem-solving mindset with the ability to think critically and adapt quickly.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working in a RevOps, sales, or marketing analytics environment.
Familiarity with other data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Basic understanding of Python for data analysis.

Data Analysis & Reporting:

Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to support the RevOps team.
Develop and maintain dashboards using Power BI to visualize data and performance metrics.

Sales Commission Management:

Play a critical role in ensuring the accurate calculation, reporting, and analysis of sales commissions every month.
Work closely with the sales team to understand commission structures and resolve any discrepancies.

CRM Data Management:

Work with Salesforce or other CRM platforms to extract and manage data effectively.
Ensure data integrity and perform regular audits for cleanliness and accuracy.

SQL Database Management:

Write, optimize, and maintain SQL queries to manage and analyze large datasets.
Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to integrate data from multiple sources.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Work closely with sales, marketing, and customer success teams to understand data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear, concise manner.

Continuous Improvement:

Identify opportunities to improve data collection and analysis processes.
Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in data analytics tools and methodologies.




Additional Notes

As we grow, we are looking to hire people who share our values and goals. Our values are the core of everything we do:

Collaboration ‚Äì Sharing knowledge, resources, and support to drive success
Ownership ‚Äì Holding ourselves accountable for delivering excellence
Respect ‚Äì Valuing everyvoice to build a stronger team
Empathy‚Äì Understanding each other to foster a supportive workplace




We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive global workplace, helping each other achieve our goals, and having fun along the way.




CoreView is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status.

As we grow, we are looking to hire people who share our values and goals. Our values are the core of everything we do:

  • Collaboration ‚Äì Sharing knowledge, resources, and support to drive success
  • Ownership ‚Äì Holding ourselves accountable for delivering excellence
  • Respect ‚Äì Valuing everyvoice to build a stronger team
  • Empathy‚Äì Understanding each other to foster a supportive workplace


We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive global workplace, helping each other achieve our goals, and having fun along the way.


CoreView is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status.

Title: Sales Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

We are seeking a Sales Data Analyst with expertise in data analysis to help optimize sales strategies and support our B2B sales team. The ideal candidate will transform platform data into actionable insights to identify business opportunities, improve sales performance, and inform strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze data from the company‚Äôs digital platform (user traffic, behavior, conversions, etc.) to support the sales team
Identify usage patterns and propose strategies to enhance customer value.
Develop detailed reports and dashboards to monitor sales performance based on platform data
Collaborate with product, marketing, data, and sales teams to align initiatives with insights generated from data analysis
Segment customers and analyze data to support targeted initiatives (e.g., upselling, cross-selling, retention)
Provide sales forecasts using platform data and predictive models
Monitor key performance indicators (e.g., acquisition rate, churn rate) to refine sales strategies
Automate analysis processes to improve efficiency and speed in delivering insights.


Your Identikit


Strong ability to communicate complex data insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
Excellent analytical thinking and attention to detail
Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams (product, sales, marketing, data)
Adaptability and comfort in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


Required Skills And Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within digital platform or e-commerce environments
Strong proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in data analysis programming languages, preferably Python
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Knowledge of statistical techniques for business-oriented data analysis


Nice To Have


Experience with machine learning models for customer segmentation, churn prediction, and sales forecasting
Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly AWS
Understanding of digital analytics and experience with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics)


Benefits


Competitive compensation package
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more


For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher. You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Data Analyst - Online Sales
Description:
Cerchi una nuova sfida?

Ti piacerebbe aiutarci a plasmare il futuro dell‚Äôassicurazione motor?

Prima potrebbe essere il posto giusto per te.

Dal 2015 mettiamo tutta la nostra passione per i dati e la tecnologia al servizio di una nuova idea di assicurazione auto, garantendo ai nostri clienti un‚Äôesperienza fantastica a un prezzo competitivo. La nostra storia √® iniziata in Italia, dove siamo rapidamente diventati il primo operatore online per l'assicurazione auto, conquistando la fiducia di oltre 4 milioni di automobilisti. Ora stiamo crescendo e puntiamo a raggiungere ancora pi√π clienti in UK e Spagna.

Per supportare questa crescita, stiamo cercando un/a Data Analyst da inserire nel nostro dipartimento Sales.

Questo team mette al centro i clienti, permettendo a Prima di crescere quotidianamente.

Come parte di questo team, ottimizzerai i nostri prodotti online per soddisfare le esigenze degli utenti e migliorare la conversione. Rafforzerai le partnership con comparatori e altri canali per raggiungere nuovi clienti.

Ti entusiasma l‚Äôidea di lasciare un segno? Ecco i dettagli

In questo ruolo sarai responsabile dell‚Äôanalisi dei comportamenti di clienti e agenti lungo tutti i touchpoint di vendita, con l‚Äôobiettivo di identificare opportunit√† e guidare decisioni strategiche basate sui dati.

Cosa farai


Impostare un sistema di analisi delle performance con estrazioni da database e strumenti come Tableau e Python.
Analizzare le performance di vendita per canale, prodotto e cliente, identificando opportunit√† di crescita e criticit√†.
Collaborare con gli stakeholder condividendo dati e insight utili alla strategia del canale di vendita.
Ottimizzare la journey di clienti e agenti analizzando i touchpoint per massimizzare i KPI di vendita.
Supportare la valutazione di nuove iniziative tramite modelli di attribuzione e analisi di business case.


Cosa Cerchiamo


Laurea in discipline quantitative (matematica, statistica, economia o finanza).
Esperienza nell‚Äôestrazione e manipolazione dati con SQL (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
Competenze analitiche e modellizzazione con Python, Tableau ed Excel.
Mentalit√† proattiva, curiosa e orientata al miglioramento continuo.
Flessibilit√†, pensiero critico e capacit√† di adattarsi a contesti dinamici e interdisciplinari.


Nice-to-Have


Esperienza internazionale e ottima conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese.
Conoscenza di almeno un tool di Business Intelligence (es. Tableau) e programmazione in Python (o R) con librerie per l‚Äôanalisi dati.
Basi solide in statistica, probabilit√†, modellizzazione matematica e tecniche di machine learning; esperienza in data analysis o consulenza √® un plus.


Perch√© ti piacer√† lavorare con noi

Vogliamo rendere Prima un ambiente di lavoro felice e stimolante. Se deciderai di unirti a noi, ti aspettano numerosi benefit.

ü§∏ Lavora a modo tuo: Lavora in modalit√† ibrida, alternando giorni in ufficio e da casa, con la possibilit√† di lavorare ovunque fino a 30 giorni all‚Äôanno.

üèÅ Cresci con noi: Avrai accesso a formazione, mentorship e piani di crescita personalizzati.

üåà Benessere e performance: Avrai assicurazione sanitaria privata, convenzioni palestra, programmi di wellbeing e supporto per la salute mentale.

Pensi di essere un match? Candidati ora!

Prima valorizza l‚Äôunicit√† di ogni persona. Se non soddisfi ogni requisito ma sei appassionato/a, candidati comunque. L‚Äôinnovazione nasce dalla diversit√†!

Prima √® un datore di lavoro inclusivo. Necessiti supporto durante la selezione? Scrivi a talent.acquisition@prima.it. Costruiamo insieme il futuro delle assicurazioni.

Title: Business & Data Analyst
HTML:
Dove lavorerai

Per la nostra sede di Milano cerchiamo candidati interessati ad un percorso professionale all'interno della Direzione Generation & Energy Management.

Su cosa lavorerai

La persona che stiamo cercando avr√† la responsabilit√† per le seguenti attivit√†:

  • analizzare i dati;
  • identificare inefficienze di processo;
  • proporre soluzioni e monitorare i progressi;
  • collaborazione con le altre aree di business nei progetti di sviluppo di modelli, strumenti e applicazioni volti al continuo miglioramento dei processi.

Cosa pu√≤ esserti utile per valutare se candidarti

  • Laurea in Informatica, Economia, Ingegneria materie STEM;
  • Perfetta conoscenza del pacchetto Office;
  • Gradita la conoscenza di strumenti di programmazione (R, Python, Qlik, ...);
  • Conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese;
  • Spirito di iniziativa;
  • Capacit√† di lavoro in team;
  • Ottime capacit√† relazionali.

La tua sede di lavoro

Lavorerai nel nostro HQs di Milano in Via A. Algardi 4 insieme al resto del tuo team di riferimento. Ci impegniamo a favorire il tuo work-life balance e quindi avrai la possibilit√†, se lo desideri, di lavorare anche in modalit√† ibrida organizzandoti con il tuo team.

Sorgenia

Nati nel 1999, siamo una Green Tech Energy Company e oggi il principale operatore energetico privato nazionale.

Scopri di pi√π su Sorgenia su www.sorgenia.it.

Cosa significa far parte di Sorgenia

Cerchiamo nuovi colleghi che, con spirito pionieristico e innovativo, siano pronti a gestire con proattivit√† e concretezza progetti sfidanti contribuendo alla continua crescita di Sorgenia.

In Sorgenia offriamo l‚Äôopportunit√† di imparare ogni giorno attraverso percorsi di formazione continua e eventi interni informali; siamo attenti al benessere delle nostre persone e per questo offriamo flessibilit√† oraria, smart working e una palestra aziendale se vuoi tenerti in forma.

Se vuoi scoprire cos‚Äôaltro offriamo in Sorgenia, candidati, non vediamo l‚Äôora di conoscerti!

Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi del decreto legislativo 11 aprile 2006 n. 198 ‚ÄúCodice delle pari opportunit√† tra uomo e donna‚Äù e a persone di tutte le et√† e nazionalit√†, ai sensi della Direttiva 2000/78/CE ‚ÄúParit√† di trattamento in materia di occupazione‚Äù

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Join FrieslandCampina as a Business Intelligence Specialist ‚Äì Agrate Office

At FrieslandCampina, we‚Äôre more than a global dairy company ‚Äî we‚Äôre a purpose-driven organization committed to nourishing the world with high-quality, nutritious products. With over 18,000 employees across 100+ countries, we are united by a passion for innovation, sustainability, and excellence.

We‚Äôre currently looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join our team in Agrate. If you're passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make a real impact across departments, this is your opportunity to be a strategic partner in a business that values smart decisions and data-led growth.

What We Ask

What You Bring

To succeed in this role, you‚Äôll bring both technical depth and business acumen. We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:


A Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Sciences, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
Three to Five years of proven experience in a Business Intelligence or Data Analytics role.
Advanced Excel skills and hands-on experience with SQL and Python.
Expertise in building and maintaining data models.
Strong communication skills in English ‚Äî able to simplify complex data for various stakeholders.
A proactive, detail-oriented mindset and a collaborative approach to problem-solving.



What We Offer

We believe in supporting our people to do their best work. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:


A competitive salary based on your experience and skills .
A hybrid working model that supports work-life balance.
Lunch vouchers and practical benefits that make a difference in your day-to-day.
Access to in-house training and continuous learning opportunities.
A collaborative, inclusive culture rooted in respect, diversity, and sustainability.



Vacancy Description

In this dynamic role, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with teams across Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Finance, using your expertise to transform complex datasets into clear, decision-driving insights.

You will:


Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to identify trends and opportunities.
Build intuitive dashboards and visualizations using tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Design and maintain data models that support strategic planning and operational excellence.
Provide actionable recommendations that guide business decisions across the organization.
Champion data quality, governance, and standardization across systems and teams.
Stay ahead of the curve by identifying new BI tools, trends, and best practices.



Staying true to who you really are, that is your starting point at FrieslandCampina. Because it is precisely by embracing our differences that we can grow together. We want to create a working environment that allows all employees to bring their best and authentic selves. If who we are suits you, but you're not sure if you're the best fit for the role, we still encourage you to apply so we can help you find the role that fits you best.

Team Details

Why FrieslandCampina?

FrieslandCampina is a unique employer ‚Äî our farmer-owned cooperative model empowers us to prioritize people, planet, and profit equally. We foster a culture of equality and inclusion, where every voice matters and every individual can thrive. We are constantly evolving, embracing innovation, and working toward a sustainable future ‚Äî together.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come:

Customer Data Analyst

Your Perspectives

Ti unirai al gruppo di Customer Transformation di PwC su sfidanti progetti di Customer Advance Analytics e Data Science in ambito Consumer Markets, Financial Services, Energy&Utilities e Telco&Media, per supportare le organizzazioni nel valorizzare il patrimonio informativo sulla propria clientela, utilizzando i dati a disposizione per sviluppare soluzioni innovative basate su Machine Learning.

Grazie all‚Äôaccesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.

Sarai coinvolto con crescenti responsabilit√† nelle seguenti attivit√†:

  • Disegno, sviluppo, test e misurazione delle performance di modelli di Machine Learning e di modelli statistici in ambito Marketing: segmentazioni, Customer scoring, modelli di classificazione, modelli predittivi, modelli di propensione/raccomandazione;
  • Analisi dati avanzate sul comportamento della clientela sia su canale fisico che digitale attraverso esplorazione di dati strutturati e destrutturati, al fine di derivare insight di business;
  • Sviluppo di analisi quantitative e modelli di Machine Learning a supporto di progettualit√† di data-driven Strategy & Decision Making;
  • Attivit√† di targeting evoluto e valutazione quantitativo-statistica delle campagne di Marketing;
  • Raccolta dei requisiti progettuali a diretto contatto con la clientela per il disegno e l‚Äôelaborazione di soluzioni data-driven;

Your unique strengths

  • Stai concludendo o hai concluso il percorso di studi o possiedi una laurea magistrale preferibilmente ad indirizzo scientifico (es. Data Science, Informatica, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica);
  • Hai un‚Äôottima conoscenza di almeno uno tra i linguaggi Python ed R;
  • Possiedi una buona conoscenza dei database relazionali e del linguaggio SQL;
  • Hai forti competenze analitiche e ti interessa usare i dati per trovare soluzioni funzionali, creative ed innovative a problemi complessi;
  • Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente;
  • Ti interessa lavorare in team e crescere in un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e positivo;
  • Sei flessibile e hai forte motivazione ad intraprendere una carriera professionale in consulenza;


Saranno considerate un plus, le conoscenze, anche a livello base di:

  • Framework Spark e piattaforme Cloud come Amazon Web Services, Azure e Google Cloud Platform;
  • Artificial Intelligence in ambito Speech Analytics, Natural Language Processing o Computer Vision;

Set your expectation higher:  

Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.  
  

 Feel at home:  

 Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone mettendole nelle condizioni di crescere ed esprimere al meglio il proprio potenziale. Ci impegniamo a creare valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunit√†, nel rispetto dell'ambiente.  

 

GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Dentsu Creative is a global creative agency network designed to unlock exponential growth for clients. We use Transformative Creativity as a differentiating, driving force to bring our capabilities together to positively impact people, business and society.

Established in 2022, Dentsu Creative is integrated with dentsu‚Äôs Media and CXM businesses in over 145 countries and regions, to offer Integrated Growth Solutions.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to be employed in our Milan office.




Role Description




We are looking for Data Analyst with boundless curiosity and a deep passion for data and innovation. Someone who not only sees the numbers, but also understands the people behind them ‚Äî a professional who blends analytical rigor with a humanistic lens on the world.




As a Data Analyst within Dentsu Creative‚Äôs award-winning strategy team, you will dive deep into numbers to decode what‚Äôs really happening around us. With a sharp analytical eye and the ability to see connections beyond the numbers, you read and interpret data to uncover the forces shaping culture, behaviours, and brands ‚Äî turning complex information into clear, strategic insights that inspire bold and impactful thinking and creativity.




You will work closely with all the Dentsu Creative verticals (Brand Strategy, Advertising, Events, Luxury, Gaming, Social, Influencer Marketing, and more) as a true 360¬∫ expert of consumer, industry and cultural trends & insights, developing insights and point of views for some of the biggest Global and Italian brands.

From insight reports to sweeping innovation projects, we're looking for someone who‚Äôs curious about the world ‚Äî someone who questions assumptions, challenges conventions, and uses data to reframe challenges and find unexpected answers.




Key Responsibilities




Analyze and present reports on digital and social performance, turning data into clear, actionable insights.
Conduct social listening analysis to identify conversation patterns, audience and brand insight.
Support the design and development of ad hoc surveys to uncover strategic insights and inform brand decision-making.
Monitor key trends and shifts, providing analysis that supports teams across dentsu with culturally informed thinking.
Help develop analysis packages for clients, supporting the creation of tailored research proposals in collaboration with different Dentsu teams.




Who we are looking for




Strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a deep curiosity constantly exploring trends, conducting desk research, and scouting for cultural signals and emerging behaviors.
Skilled at translating complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that inform creative thinking and shape brand relevance ‚Äî both for people and algorithms.
Strong communicator who knows how to get to the point ‚Äî making data feel accessible, relevant, and compelling in both written and spoken form.
Proficient in PowerPoint, with the ability to craft presentations that inform, persuade, and guide strategic decisions.
Collaborative and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and a habit of going beyond task execution to find smarter solutions.
Strong team player with a talent for listening, mediation, and leading teams and clients with clear, substantiated rationales.
Comfortable working across data tools and platforms, with advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, worksheets).
Fluent in Italian (written and spoken) and fluent in written English ‚Äî good spoken English is a strong plus.
Bonus: experienced in data visualization, presenting insights in elegant, visually engaging formats.




Skills & Experience




2+ Years of proven experience with data and reporting
Skilled in processing and managing data through Excel and pivot tables
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, combined with strong expertise in data visualization and presentation
Obsessive attention to detail
Ability to effectively balance high quality with strict deadlines
Team working and collaborative attitude
Self-motivation and a problem-solving attitude
Your mother tongue is Italian, but you‚Äôre fluent in English
Proficiency with data & analytics platforms (e.g. Brandwatch) is a plus




Working with us




Joining Dentsu Creative, you will be part of a creative network, delivering ideas that are brought alive in new ways. Along the way, you will team up with inspiring people across the world and become part of a truly inclusive culture where everyone is given the opportunity to thrive and create the best work of their careers; always learning and always listening to shape ideas, create culture and change behaviour. By bringing together the capabilities, experience and relationships of our collective experts, the opportunities for personal growth and development are endless.




We are united by four signature strengths:




Boundless Creativity ‚Äì Kitsune Fox: In Japanese culture ‚Äì the Kitsune Fox sees the future. We run towards the future, forever asking: what‚Äôs next? Our imagination has no limit. Our clients seek us out because we believe there is no problem we cannot solve with the power of modern creativity.




Intelligent Scale - Ryujin Dragon: The Ryujin Dragon controls the ocean and the tides. We flow the right talent around the right brief in the right moment, wherever it sits in the world. We scale our unique ideas with precision, using intelligent technology to make personal connections with millions around the world.




Obsessive Craft - Orizuru Crane: The Orizuru Crane carries the soul up to paradise. It inspires the most classic and iconic Japanese origami. We elevate the soul of our work with an obsessive focus on craft, nurturing the next-gen craft skills needed to soar in a modern world.




Radical Collaboration - Kohaku Koi: The Koi swim upstream against the tide, united as one. We chart new territory through the power of radical collaboration. We seamlessly connect Creativity, Media and CXM to imagine new solutions at the intersection of craft, data, culture, and innovation.




Our Values




We believe our work can only resonate in the modern world if the people behind it reflect the modern work. We can only be truly relevant when we create a truly inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. That means ‚Äì we are tough on the work but gentle with each other. We lead with empathy and are always listening and always learning. We support each other, we cheer for each other, we win together. We celebrate difference as the only way to make the work that makes a difference.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Milan (IT)

Octopus Energy Italia üáÆüáπ ‚Äì Data /

Full-time /

Hybrid



Benvenuti nel futuro dell‚Äôenergia!

La missione di Octopus Energy √® rendere l‚Äôenergia rinnovabile accessibile a tutti.

Grazie alla tecnologia, stiamo guidando la rivoluzione energetica a livello globale, offrendo energia pulita a prezzi convenienti e un servizio clienti sbalorditivo.

Se non ti piacciono le sfide non inviarci la tua candidatura ;)

In Octopus Energy non amiamo la burocrazia, le regole troppo stringenti e le offerte commerciali poco chiare.

Vogliamo rivoluzionare il mercato energetico italiano. Per farlo, siamo alla ricerca di persone motivate, che condividano i nostri stessi valori.

Se hai a cuore il futuro del nostro pianeta e vuoi aiutarci a migliorare il settore energetico, unisciti al nostro team!

Con la crescita vertiginosa che stiamo avendo in Octopus, √® emersa la straordinaria opportunit√† di fare la differenza andando a utilizzare in modo intelligente e creativo la grande mole di dati che ogni giorno gestiamo come compagnia energetica. Per fare questo abbiamo quindi deciso di aprire una posizione come Senior Data Analyst.

Cosa farai


Collaborerai con il business per definire i requisiti analitici e individuare i dati rilevanti per soddisfarli
Lavorerai a stretto contatto con Data Engineers e Data Scientists producendo analisi approfondite dei dati per estrarre insight utili e solidi utili al fine di guidare proattivamente le decisioni aziendali
Eseguirai attivit√† di profilazione, pulizia e trasformazione dei dati, garantendone accuratezza e consistenza
Consoliderai e svilupperai modelli dati scalabili ed efficienti per il reporting aziendale
Condurrai analisi e visualizzazioni tramite strumenti Dashboarding e BI, in uno stack tecnologico moderno
Gestirai progetti analitici end-to-end: dalla comprensione delle esigenze di business alla comunicazione chiara ed efficace dei risultati, soprattutto attraverso tecniche di data storytelling



Cosa ti serve


Propensione ad essere curiosi e a farsi domande
Almeno 6 anni di esperienza
Capacit√† di gestione delle priorit√† in un ambiente in rapida crescita
Buona padronanza di alcuni concetti base dell‚Äôambito finance e contabilit√† (attivit√† di rendicontazione, stato patrimoniale, conto economico e simili)
Buona conoscenza dell'inglese
Esperienza pregressa di Python
Conoscenza dei test e delle tecniche statistiche
Buona conoscenza di SQL
Capacit√† di costruire processi ETL e/o di mantenere un Data Lake
Conoscenza del workflow dbt √® considerata un plus



Il nostro Stack


Python come linguaggio principale e SQL per query e analytics
Kubernetes per servizi dati e orchestrazione task
Airflow per scheduling e monitoraggio
Git, Github e Circle CI per versioning e continuous deployment
Formati Parquet e Delta su S3 per data lake
Spark per data processing
dbt per modellazione dati
Streamlit (python) per applicazioni dati e principale strumento di Dashboarding



Cos'altro ti piacer√† di noi


Octopus Energy rappresenta una cultura unica: un'organizzazione in cui le persone imparano, prendono decisioni e costruiscono pi√π rapidamente. Dove le persone lavorano con autonomia, accanto a una vasta gamma di co-proprietari straordinari, su progetti che rompono schemi. Vogliamo che il tuo duro lavoro venga premiato con vantaggi che ti interessano davvero!
Equity Options Scheme - possiedi la tua parte dell'azienda, opzioni di azioni nell'intero Octopus Energy Group: tutti lavoriamo insieme per il successo.
Cultura dell'ufficio - Ogni settimana, il venerd√¨, ci riuniamo tutti (questo avviene anche virtualmente) per gli aggiornamenti aziendali e un brindisi - lo chiamiamo Family Dinner.

Title: Junior Finance/Data Analyst
Description:
Fler is on a full-time mission to reshape the way consumer goods are perceived with the customer and the experience in focus. We are an innovative and fast-growing startup that wants to innovate the shaving and body-care industry and that loves to break today's standards.




We are currently looking for a Junior Data & Finance Analyst to join our team and strengthen our financial planning and performance analysis capabilities. In this role, you will not only ensure accuracy in reporting and financial documentation, but also transform raw data into actionable insights - from customer cohorts to product and channel profitability. By turning numbers into insights, you will help drive faster, smarter decisions across marketing, retail, and product, directly contributing to the sustainable growth of the company.


Tasks



Support the development of comprehensive monthly reports and detailed performance analysis, including but not limited to P&L, cash flow, and product margins, ensuring accuracy and timeliness in all financial documentation.


Organize, clean, and validate data gathered from various internal sources, and build insightful dashboards using tools such as Google Sheets, Excel, and Looker Studio to facilitate data-driven decision-making.


Conduct cohort analyses and monitor customer lifetime value (CLV) to assess retention and purchasing behavior, providing actionable insights for long-term growth.


Analyze product and channel profitability, identifying margin improvement opportunities and inefficiencies across the business.


Contribute to the development of internal and investor reporting materials, ensuring clarity and precision in all communications.


Segment data across acquisition channels, product clusters, and customer typologies to provide strategic insights for pricing, promotions, and trade marketing.


Assist in translating complex bookkeeping data into actionable operational insights and accurate forecasts, aiding strategic planning.


Collaborate closely with marketing, retail, and product teams to support informed business decisions, leveraging financial and data insights to drive growth and efficiency.



Requirements



Degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, or related field


1 year of experience in similar roles (Business Analyst, Finance, Data)


Analytical thinker, strong with numbers and spreadsheets


Curious, tech-savvy, and eager to learn new tools


Detail-oriented, proactive, and organized


Hands-on self-starter comfortable with fast turnarounds


Bonus: familiarity with SQL, Google BigQuery, or data visualization tools



Benefits


Our philosophy is simple: we dream big, move fast and enhance each other's talents. As a brand, we are only as strong as the people who surround us. In this role you will:





Work on real business analysis from day one, with tangible impact


Collaborate across functions in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment


Join an incredible early-stage company where your decisions have immediate impact





To apply, please complete the form at the link below ‚Äì it is a mandatory step of our hiring process. Candidates who do not submit the form will not be considered.




üëâ https://flerworld.typeform.com/to/O1815jD0




If we believe there‚Äôs a potential match and your form meets our expectations, you will be contacted within 10 days for the next step of the process. We review every submission with care ‚Äî thank you for your time and interest in Fler!

Title: Data Analyst with Power BI
Description:
As part of its team expansion, FastCode S.p.A. is looking for a Data Analyst.

We are seeking a professional with at least 1 year of experience in analytics or reporting, even at the beginning of their structured career, who has a good knowledge of Power BI and is eager to grow in the areas of data visualization, reporting, and business analysis.

The selected candidate will join a team dedicated to analyzing company data and building interactive dashboards, with the aim of supporting decision-making processes through reliable analysis and effective visualizations.

The working environment is dynamic, collaborative, and constantly evolving, with continuous training, hands-on support, and opportunities for growth into roles such as data specialist or business analyst.

Key Responsibilities:


Create and update interactive dashboards in Power BI
Analyze data from various sources (databases, Excel files, business systems)
Collaborate with business teams to understand reporting needs and KPI measurement
Turn raw data into clear, decision-oriented visualizations
Ensure quality, consistency, and timely updates of datasets
Document analysis processes and calculation criteria



Required Technical Skills:


Solid command of Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and cloud publishing
Knowledge of SQL (basic/intermediate level)
Excellent knowledge of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
Ability to process and transform datasets for analytical purposes
Understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics



Preferred Technical Skills:


Experience with ETL tools or pipelines (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Talend, SSIS)
Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
Familiarity with other business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik)
Experience in finance, retail, or industrial sectors
Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)



Soft Skills Required:


Curiosity, observational skills, and interest in analysis
Ability to communicate effectively and make data understandable
Precision, attention to detail, and quality orientation
Proactivity and motivation for professional growth
Teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills



What We Offer:


Inclusion in an environment that values skills and professional growth
Mentorship, on-the-job training, and development of analytical capabilities
Opportunities to evolve into specialist or strategic roles
Contract and compensation based on experience



Why Choose FastCode:


The chance to work in a fast-growing, constantly evolving company
A young, international team environment
Training aligned with job-related activities
Corporate benefits (Health Insurance, Meal Vouchers)
Hybrid work model (1 day remote, 4 days onsite)



FastCode S.p.A. actively promotes an inclusive work environment that respects differences. Applications are open to all individuals, regardless of gender, in accordance with Legislative Decree 198/2006. We believe that valuing diversity and ensuring equal opportunities are key drivers of innovation and organizational well-being.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK).

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.
