  • SUMMARY


NATO‚Äôs Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Office of Strategic Communications actively strengthens NATO‚Äôs public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Office also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands. The Digital Technology and Infrastructure Section manages NATO‚Äôs communication technology and infrastructure, including NATO‚Äôs broadcast operations and the NATO website.

The incumbent, under the overall direction of the Deputy Director of the Office of Strategic Communications, is responsible for:

  • the coordination of the broadcast and photographic coverage of high-level public events taking place at NATO HQ and abroad,
  • the day-to-day management of the teams covering these events, and
  • overseeing the operation and maintenance of the required digital broadcast equipment and infrastructure.


This includes liaising with internal and external stakeholders, and coordinating the day-to-day activities involving the TV studio and the different video production environments. This is a hands-on position requiring extensive professional broadcast expertise, paired with management and stakeholder‚Äôs management experience.

  • QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE


Essential

The incumbent must:

  • possess a university degree in film, video and TV broadcasting from an institute of recognised standing or equivalent qualification;
  • have at least three years of professional experience in the field of digital radio and television broadcasting equipment;
  • have extensive professional experience in multimedia production, and/or overseeing multimedia production;
  • have experience in managing small teams in the broadcast environment;
  • have proven experience in stakeholder management;
  • possess the following minimum levels of NATO‚Äôs official languages (English/French): V (‚ÄúAdvanced‚Äù) in one; I (‚ÄúBeginner‚Äù) in the other .


DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:

  • professional experience in digital asset management systems;
  • proven experience in working with procurement regulations;
  • sound political judgement and diplomacy skills;
  • experience working at an international organisation.
  • MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES


Planning and Execution

Coordinate the calendar of upcoming events with internal stakeholders (e.g, NATO Spokesperson) regarding expected outcomes and deliverables. Manage the internal and external teams transmitting, recording, editing video, audio and photo deliverables from the different events at NATO HQ and abroad. Ensure availability and operability of the required digital broadcast infrastructure and equipment, including the distribution of live video feeds via online streaming platforms, satellite and optical fibre systems, the TV and radio studio, and the video- and audio pre- and post-production facilities for Digital Technology and Infrastructure Section.

Expertise Development

Remain up-to-date with current technology in the fields of broadcast and developments in digital video transmission, recording and production. Conduct installation and testing of various equipment. Provide staff with the opportunity to learn how to maintain and operate new broadcast equipment.

Stakeholder Management

Liaise with internal stakeholders for the coordination of the required coverage of public high-level events including visits of national dignitaries to NATO HQ, trips of NATO VIPs abroad and recordings in the TV or radio studio. Liaise directly with internal stakeholders such as the NATO Procurement service and the NATO Office of Security, and with external stakeholders to ensure optimal execution of tasks including provision of services and staff, and the acquisition of equipment. Be able to work as part of a team in demanding situations such as Summits, ministerial meetings and special events, both at NATO Headquarters and abroad.

Project Management

Coordinate in close consultation with the relevant Press and Media Officers equipment and staffing needs for Summit, ministerial meetings, press conferences and special events held at NATO Headquarters and elsewhere. This can include extensive liaising with host nations and host nation broadcasters, international media outlets and digital media service suppliers to ensure that strict deadlines are met and that NATO‚Äôs message, brand and image are optimally distributed worldwide.

People Management

Oversee directly a core permanent staff and indirectly a more extensive teams of external contractors. Plan their workloads to meet the needs for a given project, as well as for day-to-day operations with the assistance of the Broadcast Coordinator.

Financial Management

Be responsible for the planning of the hiring of services as well as of the acquisition of equipment and infrastructure. This includes the provisioning of human and technical resources through the framework contract for the broadcast and photographic coverage of public events, the rental of services for the transmission and distribution of live video feeds, and the acquisition and maintenance of equipment and infrastructure. Be familiar with and adhere to NATO financial and procurement rules and regulations.

Information Management

Design and implement a proper information strategy to document day-to-day financial and operational activities and to maintain a calendar of events for the internal and external teams.

Perform any other related duty as assigned.

  • INTERRELATIONSHIPS


The incumbent reports to the Deputy Director of the Office of Strategic Communications. On a daily basis, they supervise permanent and contract staff and their broadcast and photographic work including during Summits, ministerial meetings, special events, trips abroad and other events as required.

Direct reports: 5

Indirect reports: N/a.

  • COMPETENCIES


The incumbent must demonstrate:

  • Achievement: Creates own measures of excellence and improves performance.
  • Analytical Thinking: Sees multiple relationships;
  • Customer Service Orientation: Makes things better for the customer, addressing underlying customer needs;
  • Flexibility: Adapts to unforeseen situations;
  • Initiative: Plans and acts up to a year ahead;
  • Organisational Commitment: Places the Organization above personal considerations;
  • Self-Control: Stays composed and positive even under extreme pressure;

Title: Young Graduate Business Analyst - Data & Analytics Team
Description:
Working on innovative solutions to address emerging business challenges, you will have the opportunity to make a difference in genuine partnership with market-leading clients, impacting the way people work and live in the future.




We are offering you an interesting and challenging position as




A Young Graduate Business Analyst




Main responsibilities:




Collaborate on the design and implementation of effective data management frameworks.
Work closely with market-leading clients to understand their unique data governance needs.
Assist in developing and executing comprehensive data governance solutions.
Contribute to the development and optimization of data models, structures, and workflows.
Implement and operate data governance tools, ensuring their efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver customer-focused outcomes.
Demonstrate strong analytical and programming skills when needed.




Ideal profile:




Recent MSc or MA graduate in Computer Science, Information Management, Business Engineering, or a related field.
Proficient in English, with a good command in French and/or Dutch.
Keen interest and basic knowledge in data management and data governance.
Familiarity with data models, structures, and workflows.
Exposure to at least one data governance tool is advantageous.
Proactive mindset and entrepreneurial spirit.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
Team player with a customer-success-oriented approach.
Programming skills are considered a plus.

BearingPoint offers you:




An enriching career within a leading European Business Consulting firm with a people-centric approach.
The possibility to work on several international projects within an easy-going team.
Cross-level collaborations with our data experts, eager to share their knowledge.
Excellent growth opportunities while having access to high-quality trainings and tailor-made coaching.
An individual support from a Development Manager.
An attractive salary package (mobile phone and laptop, company car with international energy card or a mobility budget allowance, meal vouchers, hospitalization coverage and group insurance, performance-related bonus).

Apply and become part of a quality-driven practice excelling in Data Governance!

Title: Data Analyst (3-month internship)
Description:
Job Description

Purpose of the position:

Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities

Position Functions


Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Connect & Align with Marketing
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Competitor Set Mapping
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics


Knowledge And Skills Required


Bachelor Degree
Good Excel / Microsoft Office Skills
Power BI knowledge is a plus
English fluent mandatory
Ability to connect with cross functional teams


#PanEurope

About Us

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin‚Äô good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can‚Äôt share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We‚Äôre part of Yum! Brands, Inc.‚Äîcollaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we‚Äôve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow‚Äôs technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you‚Äôve ever tasted. We exist to feed people‚Äôs potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.

The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.

Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we‚Äôre grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for a client in Geneva







Mission:




Build an action tracking tool using the Power suite technology based on new and existing processes.
Collaborate with the team to establish dashboards that track the status and action plans per entity using the data in their existing tools.
Set up an easy to use template for the monthly reporting of project status, risk results, mitigation measure tracking etc. combining the data from the existing solutions and the new action tracking app.
Support the teams with smaller dashboarding requirements using Power BI or other solutions.




Profile

You have proven experience with Power BI and other data analytics tool.
You are able to hit the ground running and quickly understand and assimilate needs.
A working knowledge of English is necessary in order to communicate with our regional stakeholders and senior management.










Start Date: ASAP

Duration: 3 months with possibility to be extended

Workload: 80 %

Location: Geneva

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities


Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.




Skills and Abilities


Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.




With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.




Lombard Odier Investment Managers (‚ÄúLOIM‚Äù) is the asset management business of the Lombard Odier Group. In order to strengthen our IT team, we are looking for a Geneva based:




Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì Temporary




YOUR ROLE




Participate in support and production activities, including monitoring and maintaining BI jobs and servers
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues related to workflows and dashboards
Support our Business & Product Development team with data request and reporting needs
Migrate manual process (excel) into automated Alteryx workflows & Tableau dashboards
Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Product Development and Client Portfolio Managers to build data solution to help decision making & business tracking
Provide guidance and support to business users in utilizing our Business intelligence for self-service analytics and reporting




YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES




University degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent
Familiarity with Business Intelligence platforms ‚Äì Tableau & Alteryx preferred
Basic knowledge of Python
Team player with strong communication skills
Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work in fast paced environment




Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.




As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison‚Äôs DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy

An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.


With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.


Lombard Odier Investment Managers (‚ÄúLOIM‚Äù) is the asset management business of the Lombard Odier Group. In order to strengthen our IT team, we are looking for a Geneva based:


Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì Temporary

Title: Junior Investment / Data Analyst (60-100%)
Description:
Progressive Capital Partners Ltd is an independent Swiss investment boutique focused on alternative investments since its founding in 2001.




Progressive Capital Partners is an authorised asset manager of collective investment schemes and representative of foreign collective investment schemes, supervised by FINMA. Our team is focused on managing investments across diversifying hedge funds (incl. global macro, CTAs, long volatility / convexity, commodities) as well as niche alternative strategies. We are specialised in de-correlated strategies, offering diversification benefits to clients‚Äô more traditional portfolios.




To complement our growing team, we are looking for a




Junior Investment / Data Analyst (60-100%)




We offer a dynamic and diverse work environment within an experienced and entrepreneurial team with high personal responsibility. From the very beginning, you will gain broad exposure across different areas of our business and support the team with a wide range of tasks:




Assisting with the analysis and preparation of reporting and market data,
supporting the selection (incl. due diligence) and ongoing monitoring of invested funds and mandates,
contributing to presentations, reports, and research documents for clients and internal use,
maintaining and further developing tools and databases (Excel; programming skills are a clear plus),
collaborating with the portfolio management and operations teams on various administrative, reporting and organizational tasks, incl. shadow accounting, reconciliations, client reportings, etc.,
contributing to market and strategy research (global focus, across different asset classes).




For these demanding tasks, we are looking for a passionate Junior Investment / Data Analyst who is interested in a broad and truly alternative investment universe with the following background:




Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g. business administration, economics, finance, mathematics, data science, natural sciences, or related studies),
initial practical experience gained through internships or working student positions is a plus,
strong interest in financial markets and willingness to take on a broad range of responsibilities,
analytical mindset with a structured and detail-oriented way of working is required,
solid knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel (basic programming skills in VBA, SQL, Python, or similar are an advantage, but not required),
team-oriented with a service-minded attitude,
rigorous, detail oriented, organised, and analytical,
fluent in English, at least conversation level in German,
residency in Switzerland or willingness to relocate.




Please send your complete application documents to hr@progressivecapital.com. We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: KFC Europe - Data Analyst Internship (3 month) - M/F
Description:
About us #PANEUROPE




From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin‚Äô good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can‚Äôt share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.




We‚Äôre part of Yum! Brands, Inc.‚Äîcollaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we‚Äôve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original. For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow‚Äôs technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you‚Äôve ever tasted. We exist to feed people‚Äôs potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.




We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact. The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so. Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we‚Äôre grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.




Job description




Data Analyst, support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities.




Job functions




Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization

Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Connect & Align with Marketing




Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe

Competitor Set Mapping
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition




Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics

Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics




Knowledge and skills required




Bachelor Degree
Good Excel / Microsoft Office Skills
Power BI knowledge is a plus
English fluent mandatory
Ability to connect with cross functional teams




Location - Candidate should be based in Lausanne.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT:

L‚ÄôOccitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).




MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L‚ÄôOccitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins
Support the deployment of Power BI solution




HOW YOU CAN FIT:

Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is preferred
Proficiency in Excel and Power BI
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline




STARTING DATE: January 2026 for 6 months (full-time position)




LOCATION: Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

Title: Business insights analyst Intern
Description:
About Us:

CHANEL is a dynamic and innovative player in the travel retail industry, committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our global customers. As part of our continued growth, we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Insights Analyst Intern to join our Global Travel Retail Team. This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our business through insightful data analysis and reporting.

Position Overview:

As a Business Insights Analyst Intern with the Global Travel Retail Team at CHANEL, you will have a versatile role that contributes to both analytical tasks and the strategic communication of findings. You will be responsible for synthesizing business intelligence data, producing monthly reports, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making. You will play an important role in enhancing our existing data models, ensuring accuracy, and presenting information in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate is proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, possesses strong analytical skills, and is a collaborative team player.

Key Responsibilities:



Data Management and Relationship Building:
Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
Data Analysis and Recommendations:
Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
Industry Insight and Trend Analysis:
Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
Reporting Excellence :
Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyse data on the travel retail industry.
Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
Dashboard Maintenance:
Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
Support and Collaboration:
Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects & Insights Director in daily operations.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.



Job Conditions:

An internship agreement is mandatory for this position and must meet the following conditions:



The internship must be part of your study program.
The internship must be required for the completion of your degree.
The internship must be validated by the award of academic credits.



Job Information:



Contract: Full-time internship (100%) and in-person
Start date: January 5, 2026
Duration: 6 months
Working days: 5 days a week, Monday to Friday
Location: Geneva



Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Your mission


Performing data analyses and summarizing financially relevant data from various departments (i.e., target/actual comparisons, KPIs, etc.)
Creating and further developing code-based reports and BI dashboards with a quantitative focus for various stakeholders
Supporting the maintenance, validation, and documentation of databases, data pipelines, and software interfaces
Improving data quality using appropriate tools, further developing existing collection methods, and visualizing the results
Automating and optimizing data processes and assisting with the rollout of new data solutions
Performing backtests on raw data to analyze and evaluate investment, fund, and company data
Assisting with administrative tasks such as coordinating data access or reporting requests and preparing presentation content


Your profile


Completed degree in data science, business informatics, computer science, or a comparable qualification
Initial professional experience in a data-driven environment is an advantage
Solid knowledge of R, Python, SQL, and Excel
Basic knowledge of quantitative financial analysis and data interpretation in an investment context
Strong affinity for numbers, analytical skills, results-oriented approach, and willingness to learn
Confident written and spoken German, ideally good English skills
Independent, self-reliant approach to working in a team


Why us?


Dynamically growing company with flat hierarchies
A wide range of creative opportunities
Committed and motivated team
Attractive salary package
Training and development opportunities
Flexible working hours
Modern offices in a central location


Notes regarding your application

We look forward to receiving your application!

Please fill out our online application form and upload your complete application documents. Once we have received your documents, we will send you a confirmation.

Please note that we can only accept applications submitted via the online form.

Title: Junior Financial Data Analyst Graduate
Description:
Launch your career with impact!

We‚Äôre looking for curious, motivated graduates with strong people skills who want to grow, learn, and make a difference. If you hold a Bachelor‚Äôs, Master‚Äôs, or PhD and have up to three years of professional experience, apply to our 18-month Graduate Programme starting 1 September 2026.

You‚Äôll gain hands-on experience in the fast-paced world of reinsurance, rotate into a different team, and receive tailored training to build your expertise. This is your chance to shape your future ‚Äì and help protect societies from the world‚Äôs most complex risks.

About The Role

As a Junior Financial Data Analyst, you'll work at the intersection of risk analytics and capability development, creating powerful insights that drive decision-making. This cross-functional position offers the opportunity to support multiple product areas while engaging in meaningful project work that makes a real difference.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze scenarios to determine impact on risk measures and balance sheet metrics
Support management reporting through execution and enhancement of risk reports
Evaluate financial market risks embedded within reinsurance transactions using in-house models
Integrate data across various internal and external sources to create unified insights
Develop risk models and tools to enhance analytical capabilities across the organization


About The Team

Risk Monitoring & Analytics (RMA) within the Solvency & Financial Risk Management (SFRM) department will be your homebase during the programme. You will have the opportunity to complete one or two rotations of 16-20 weeks in total (possible destinations could be Treasury, Asset Management or other areas of the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department such as credit risk management, risk modelling, financial model validation). SFRM has presence in Zurich, London, New York City / Armonk, and Bangalore. RMA is mandated to report risks and analytics to internal and external stakeholders (e.g. regulators).

About You

We're looking for a curious, detail-oriented individual with strong analytical skills and a passion for financial data. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with excellent communication abilities and thrives in a collaborative environment where continuous learning is encouraged.

We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements


Master's degree in a quantitative subject (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Finance) with up to 3 years of professional experience
Solid coding skills in at least one major computer language (R and/or Python)
Intellectual curiosity, drive and interest in financial and quantitative topics
Full proficiency in English


Desirable But Not Required


Prior professional experience with financial risk management (quantitative / market / credit etc.), Treasury or within Asset Management in the banking or (re)insurance sector


Opportunities For Further Learning And Growth


Gain insights on how Assets, Liabilities and Capital are managed in a large Reinsurance setup
Understand the modeling and valuation of a wide variety of financial securities and insurance products
MS SQL Server databases and Analysis Services and/or with the DAX query language
Deep R proficiency incl package development, environment management, code optimization, RShiny dashboards etc
Explore opportunities on a variety of Gen AI use cases


The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

The application process is open for at least 4 weeks and if you do not hear from us within this time frame, it does not mean your application is ignored. We will get back to you latest by mid-November.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Reference Code: 135186
Show more
HTML:
Launch your career with impact!

We‚Äôre looking for curious, motivated graduates with strong people skills who want to grow, learn, and make a difference. If you hold a Bachelor‚Äôs, Master‚Äôs, or PhD and have up to three years of professional experience, apply to our 18-month Graduate Programme starting 1 September 2026.

You‚Äôll gain hands-on experience in the fast-paced world of reinsurance, rotate into a different team, and receive tailored training to build your expertise. This is your chance to shape your future ‚Äì and help protect societies from the world‚Äôs most complex risks.

About The Role

As a Junior Financial Data Analyst, you'll work at the intersection of risk analytics and capability development, creating powerful insights that drive decision-making. This cross-functional position offers the opportunity to support multiple product areas while engaging in meaningful project work that makes a real difference.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze scenarios to determine impact on risk measures and balance sheet metrics
  • Support management reporting through execution and enhancement of risk reports
  • Evaluate financial market risks embedded within reinsurance transactions using in-house models
  • Integrate data across various internal and external sources to create unified insights
  • Develop risk models and tools to enhance analytical capabilities across the organization

About The Team

Risk Monitoring & Analytics (RMA) within the Solvency & Financial Risk Management (SFRM) department will be your homebase during the programme. You will have the opportunity to complete one or two rotations of 16-20 weeks in total (possible destinations could be Treasury, Asset Management or other areas of the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department such as credit risk management, risk modelling, financial model validation). SFRM has presence in Zurich, London, New York City / Armonk, and Bangalore. RMA is mandated to report risks and analytics to internal and external stakeholders (e.g. regulators).

About You

We're looking for a curious, detail-oriented individual with strong analytical skills and a passion for financial data. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with excellent communication abilities and thrives in a collaborative environment where continuous learning is encouraged.

We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements

  • Master's degree in a quantitative subject (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Finance) with up to 3 years of professional experience
  • Solid coding skills in at least one major computer language (R and/or Python)
  • Intellectual curiosity, drive and interest in financial and quantitative topics
  • Full proficiency in English

Desirable But Not Required

  • Prior professional experience with financial risk management (quantitative / market / credit etc.), Treasury or within Asset Management in the banking or (re)insurance sector

Opportunities For Further Learning And Growth

  • Gain insights on how Assets, Liabilities and Capital are managed in a large Reinsurance setup
  • Understand the modeling and valuation of a wide variety of financial securities and insurance products
  • MS SQL Server databases and Analysis Services and/or with the DAX query language
  • Deep R proficiency incl package development, environment management, code optimization, RShiny dashboards etc
  • Explore opportunities on a variety of Gen AI use cases

The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

The application process is open for at least 4 weeks and if you do not hear from us within this time frame, it does not mean your application is ignored. We will get back to you latest by mid-November.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Reference Code: 135186

Title: Safety Science Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Sobi offers the opportunity to work at an international pharmaceutical company focused on specialty pharmaceuticals meeting the high medical needs of rare disease patients and providing treatment and services to them. Our employees come from a variety of backgrounds within research, healthcare, industry and the academic sphere.

Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!

At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.

As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.

We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.

Job Description

The Safety Science Data Analyst supports the Safety Science department‚Äôs mission of safeguarding patient health by generating actionable insights from safety data. This role will play a critical role in analyzing, visualizing, and reporting safety data to support signal detection, regulatory compliance, and informed safety-related decision-making. This position is essential to maintaining data accuracy, consistency, and traceability while enhancing the PV data infrastructure in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.

The Safety Science Data Analyst works collaboratively with other members of the Safety Science Team, the Sobi Global Pharmacovigilance team, the Global PV Vendor System Manager, IT, Statistical and Medical Data Intelligence Center, and Quality, and other relevant functions across Sobi, to ensure that safety science activities are delivered to ethical and safety quality standards to ensure safety of patients, and compliance with GVP, GCP and worldwide regulatory requirements. It operates in collaboration with the Global PV Vendor System Manager to provide performance oversight, facilitate the generation of specific Safety surveillance and ad hoc reports and contribute to the proper configuration and maintenance of the vendor safety database. This includes leading internal initiatives for IT system and data handling enhancements, as well as contributing to vendor(s)‚Äô initiatives. Other areas of focus include but are not limited to, piloting and implementing new technologies, integrating safety science advancements and innovation projects e.g. on smart data handling, retrieval and visualization improvements.

Key Responsibilities

Including, but not limited to the following:


Act as super user in the vendor‚Äôs safety database, collaborate with the Global PV Vendor System Manager and prepare data retrieval and visualization requests required for process-related or ad hoc activities.
Evaluate and implement (as appropriate) fit for purpose data presentation e.g. for safety surveillance and signal evaluation activities, for aggregated reports or special scenarios including ad hoc requests from Health Authorities.
Generate safety reports and dashboards using tools such as Excel, Power BI, and other data visualization platforms.
Perform safety data queries and trend analyses from the safety database to identify patterns and anomalies.
Support signal detection activities by providing data-driven insights and visualizations of case trends.
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and traceability of safety data to meet regulatory and organizational standards.
Collaborate with IT teams, safety advisers, and the PV System Vendor Manager to enhance and optimize the data infrastructure.
Translate complex data outputs into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of PV processes by identifying opportunities for automation and efficiency in data handling.
Maintain compliance with global pharmacovigilance regulations and guidelines in all data-related activities.
Acts as back-up for the Global PV Vendor System Manager.


Core Interactions

This Position Will Work Closely With:


Safety Advisers to provide data insights for case evaluations and signal detection.
Statistical and Medical Data Intelligence Center to ensure high-quality clinical outputs and visualizations
IT teams to ensure the robustness and scalability of PV data systems.
The PV System Vendor Manager to address system-related issues and implement enhancements.
Regulatory Affairs and Quality Assurance teams to ensure alignment with compliance requirements.


Size & Dimension of the Role


Responsible for generating and maintaining safety reports and dashboards for ~35,000 cases annually.
Authority to design and review data visualizations and reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Expected to handle multiple projects simultaneously with minimal supervision, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality outputs.


Qualifications

Education/Learning Experience/Work Experience

Required:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Biostatistics, Computer Science, Life Sciences, or a related field.
Knowledge of pharmacovigilance principles and safety databases (e.g., Argus, ARISg)
3-4 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.
Hands-on experience with pharmacovigilance processes and case data structures is highly desirable.


Skills/Knowledge/Languages

Required:


Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Power BI, SQL, and Python/R.
Strong understanding of pharmacovigilance processes, safety databases, and case data structures.
Excellent data visualization skills with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner.
Knowledge of MedDRA coding and the ability to assess the impact of MedDRA updates on safety data and reporting.
Familiarity with safety database updates and their implications for PV operations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Fluency in English (written and spoken); additional language skills are a plus.
Ability to work effectively to fulfill ambitious goals
Sound and balanced judgment skills; able to assess and handle risks; self-confident, proactive and decisive
Strong collaborator within PV function, leadership and the wider organisation
Has the expertise, determination and courage to resolve or escalate issues as appropriate


Personal Attributes

Required:


Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Proactive and self-motivated with a commitment to continuous learning and improvement.
Adaptable to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
Proven delivery focus and solution builder


Additional Information

How to apply

We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.

Why Join Us?

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:


Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Competitive compensation for your work
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


Sobi is a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. We are a specialised international biopharmaceutical company transforming the lives of people with rare and debilitating diseases, providing reliable access to innovative medicines in the areas of haematology, immunology, and specialty care. Sobi‚Äôs share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. More about Sobi at sobi.com and LinkedIn.

We know our employees are our most valuable asset and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.

Sobi Culture

At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.

As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can‚Äôt change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Gravis Robotics is a startup that turns heavy construction machines into intelligent and autonomous robots. Our unique combination of learning-based automation and augmented remote control lets one operator safely conduct a fleet of earthmoving machines in a gamified environment. Our team has over a decade of academic experience honing the cutting edge of large-scale robotics, and is rapidly growing to bring that expertise into a trillion dollar industry through active deployments with market leaders.

About The Job

At Gravis, we engineer solutions at the nexus of hardware and software every day: bringing new perception and control technologies onto awesome, autonomous machines. Our Rooftop Autonomous Control Kit (Rack) combines sensors, compute, communication and networking modules toward a manufacturer-agnostic solution that can be applied to a variety of construction machines regardless of type and age. We are seeking a passionate and experienced Data Analytics Intern to join our team for a 6-month duration: you will play a crucial role in setting up our data pipeline and analyzing data from our autonomous excavators. You will work closely with a team of talented engineers to build up our analytics infrastructure and extract insights for engineering and business leaders. We are a team that values collaboration & innovation and contributions are directly visible.

Key Responsibilities


Design and implement robust data pipelines for collecting, storing, and processing data from autonomous machine operations and simulations
Set up and maintain data infrastructure, including databases, data warehouses, and ETL processes
Develop and optimize data models to support analytical and reporting needs
Collaborate with engineering and business teams to understand data requirements and deliver scalable data solutions
Automate data-related tasks and build tools to improve data accessibility and usability
Continuously monitor and improve the performance and reliability of the data pipeline



Required Qualifications


Completed Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, or a related field
Experience with data pipelines, cloud infrastructure and data analysis
Coding skills in C++ or Python
Clear communication, strong problem-solving skills, and a collaborative mindset



Preferred Skills


Experience with SQL databases
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and data warehousing
Fast learner and not afraid to ask questions
Proactive personality with an urge to deliver high quality outcomes
Self motivated team player who is up to the challenge of bringing data from construction sites to business insights



Don't meet every requirement? If you're enthusiastic about this role but your experience doesn't match every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be the perfect candidate for this or other positions.

This is an opportunity to join a dynamic and versatile team, and to be part of a young startup that will revolutionize heavy construction. Gravis Robotics offers a fair market salary and a working location in the vibrant city of Zurich. As a forward-facing startup, we understand that work-life balance and flexibility are important considerations for many professionals: If you are a highly qualified candidate with the requisite skills and experience, we encourage you to apply and discuss your preferred working arrangement during the interview process.

Gravis is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team, and do not discriminate based upon race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, gender expression, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.

We are an international team that is working to solve problems with a global impact: to facilitate efficient communication and collaboration, proficiency in English is a requirement for all roles.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for candidates with hands on experience in Data Modeling and ability to work directly with customer.




Job Description - Data Modeler

Hands-on experience in designing data models
Hands-on experience with SQLs
Hands of experience on Data warehousing and ETL concepts
Analyzing and translating business needs into long-term solution data models.
Evaluating existing data systems.
Working with the development team to create conceptual data models and data flows.
Developing best practices for data coding to ensure consistency within the system.
Reviewing modifications of existing systems for cross-compatibility.
Knowledge of telecom domain is an advantage.




Are you ready to help the largest enterprises in the world create a more intelligent future with cloud, machine learning and analytics? We are expanding our highly motivated and energetic team to lead our customers through some of their most critical transformation initiatives.




About Impetus

Impetus Technologies is a digital engineering company.
We deliver expert services and products in cloud data engineering and analytics space to help large enterprises in their digital transformation journey /goals. Enabling an intelligent, data-driven future for our customers.
We solve Analytics, AI (Artificial Intelligence), and Cloud puzzle for fortune 500 companies to help drive innovation and growth for them.
Headquartered in Los Gatos, California, with offshore development centers. We also have office in Canada.
Year on Year we have grown more than 40% and have been we have been recognized as one of the best companies to work for.




Impetus's LeapLogic helps customers migrate from their legacy technologies like Teradata, Netezza, Oracle among others to a cloud-native deployment with 90%+ automation. We call it Automagical...and welcome you to share this magic of workload transformation with our customers.




Impetus' services business helps customers build enterprise-class data platforms on the most modern best-in-class cloud technologies and implement use cases that increase revenue, customer experiences, streamline supply chains, by helping build new data products and much more.

As they say, "It takes a village to..." Impetus and its community of Partners will join you on this transformation initiative.

Title: Data Analyst Operations Research (100%, all genders)
Description:
Join our cutting-edge Operations Research & ATM (Air Traffic Management) team to lead the way towards sustainable, efficient, and punctual flight operations! Be a part of the team that is shaping the future of European air traffic management and making air travel more sustainable!

Starting date: November 01, 2025 or upon agreement

12 months limited position

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in SWISS‚Äôs engagement in European SESAR research projects and work at the heart of our airline operations with the following tasks:


Lead technical developments, live operational validations and implement the Target Time Management System (TTMS) product in collaboration with industry partners
Collaborate closely with other Operations departments like Flight Dispatch and Operations Control and external partners such as Skyguide and Zurich Airport
Design and develop innovative and tailored solutions to business problems and test them in operations by developing proof of concepts and refine them into productive tools
Provide technical expertise in back- and front-end development for existing and new prototype tools
Visualize and present complex information to internal and external stakeholders and partners
Generate insights from operational data sets & trial results leading to operational improvements


Benefits


Paid maternity and paternity leave
25 days of annual vacation
Flight benefits
Remote working (e.g. from home)
Attractive company pension scheme
Subsidized parking or public transport
13th monthly salary
Diversity programmes
Company health management


Requirements

We are looking for a motivated new colleague to join our team, eager to pursue innovative ideas, exploring new technologies, and applying them in practice.


Master‚Äôs degree in aviation, engineering, or data science, or a Bachelor‚Äôs degree combined with substantial relevant experience
Min. 2 + years of professional experience as a Data Analyst, ideally in the airline/flight operations industry
Proven skills in Python or C#; experience with front-end frameworks (e.g., Angular, Dash) is an advantage
Solid understanding of modern IT practices (Cloud, DevOps, etc.) and affinity for new technologies
Ability to create clear and effective data visualizations, applying best practices to highlight key insights and support data-driven decisions.
Excellent communication and argumentation skills, proactive and creative mindset, team-oriented
Fluent in English (spoken/written), German is an advantage


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Yannick Gramfort

recruiting.services@swiss.com

  • 25 days of annual vacation
  • Flight benefits
  • Remote working (e.g. from home)
  • Attractive company pension scheme
  • Subsidized parking or public transport
  • 13th monthly salary
  • Diversity programmes
  • Company health management

Requirements

We are looking for a motivated new colleague to join our team, eager to pursue innovative ideas, exploring new technologies, and applying them in practice.

  • Master‚Äôs degree in aviation, engineering, or data science, or a Bachelor‚Äôs degree combined with substantial relevant experience
  • Min. 2 + years of professional experience as a Data Analyst, ideally in the airline/flight operations industry
  • Proven skills in Python or C#; experience with front-end frameworks (e.g., Angular, Dash) is an advantage
  • Solid understanding of modern IT practices (Cloud, DevOps, etc.) and affinity for new technologies
  • Ability to create clear and effective data visualizations, applying best practices to highlight key insights and support data-driven decisions.
  • Excellent communication and argumentation skills, proactive and creative mindset, team-oriented
  • Fluent in English (spoken/written), German is an advantage

For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Yannick Gramfort

recruiting.services@swiss.com

Title: Commercial Data & Analytics Intern
Description:
At Bavarian Nordic, we are committed to saving and improving lives by unlocking the power of the immune system. Our commercial product portfolio includes market-leading vaccines against smallpox, mpox, rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, typhoid fever, and cholera. We excel in R&D innovation, manufacturing, and commercialization, striving to improve people's health and quality of life worldwide, protecting our tomorrow. Join us in our mission to make a difference.

As part of our growth journey, we are looking to strengthen the Commercial Operations Team with a full-time Commercial Data & Analytics Intern. The position can be located in either Denmark, Switzerland, or Germany. The role will work in collaboration with the commercial teams to support data analysis and produce and maintain dashboards to track KPIs.

Join our team and let's make a difference together.

Key responsibilities:


Analyze field force and sales performance data to uncover actionable insights
Build, maintain, and enhance Power BI dashboards to improve reporting and transparency
Track SF performance KPIs to support sales managers' activities and improve sales execution
Ensure data consistency and data quality by performing checks and validations
Support the Data & Analytics team with ad hoc analysis and reporting tasks
Respond to data and analysis requests from commercial stakeholders across departments


Qualifications, preferred skills, and experience:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree/completion of a Master¬¥s degree in Statistics, Business, Econometrics, Data Analytics, or a related field
Proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling and DAX, and Excel
Comfortable working with large datasets and complex data structures
Familiarity with CRM systems and marketing automation tools is a big plus
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset
Relevant previous experience is a strong plus


The position is for a min. of 6 months.

We offer the opportunity to work in an international company with unique technology and a dedicated workforce. We welcome people who share our passion with a willingness to make a difference. We offer a dynamic and flexible work environment and an opportunity to develop your personal and academic competencies.

Caught your interest?

If you are ready to take on a pivotal role in a growing organization and drive meaningful change in healthcare, apply now and join Bavarian Nordic in our mission to improve health outcomes and foster sustainable growth.

Founded in 1994, we have +30 years of experience developing life-saving vaccines. We are a global leader in smallpox and mpox vaccines. Our commercial product portfolio contains market-leading vaccines against rabies, tick-borne encephalitis, cholera, typhoid, and Ebola. We are headquartered in Denmark and have manufacturing, research, and sales offices across Europe and North America. Our values ‚Äì our Bavarian Nordic DNA, as we like to call it ‚Äì are what guide our actions every day. We act as persistent pioneers, embrace change, value being boosted by the team, and believe in protecting lives every day. If that is also a part of your DNA, we invite you to join us in Bavarian Nordic! Bavarian Nordic is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

www.bavarian-nordic.com

Title: Data Analyst- GPS Analytics

Data Analyst ‚Äì GPS Analytics

Switzerland-based client in the Banking sector

Your Tasks


Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights
Develop, maintain, and optimize data visualizations, dashboards, and reports for stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision making
Identify opportunities for process improvements through data analysis and automation
Present findings and recommendations clearly to management and business stakeholders



Your Experience/knowledge


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field

Strong proficiency in SQL and Excel
Expertise in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)

Title: Business Insights Manager
Description:
Role Profile: Business Insights Manager (80 ‚Äì 100%)

Position Title: Business Insights Manager

Location: Baar, Switzerland

Department: Innovation and Business Excellence (IBEX)

Reports To: Commercial Excellence Lead

About AstraZeneca

At AstraZeneca, we do things differently. We‚Äôre resetting expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we‚Äôre opening up new ways to work, groundbreaking innovative methods, and bringing unexpected teams together. Here, we see the impact of our collective ideas and expertise, and the power of science to deliver them. Making the impossible a reality can mean taking a chance on an idea and investing in our outstanding capacity for innovation and discovery. We champion trying new things and nurture a 'test and learn' culture, which means we are always progressing close to our goals. Interested? Come and join our journey.

This Is What You Will Do

The Business Insights Manager is responsible for delivering strategic insights that drive key business decisions within our pharmaceutical operations. This role is essential in transforming data into actionable insights that align with and advance our organizational goals, supporting the marketing, sales, and medical teams, and supporting functions with evidence-based strategies. The Business Insights Manager informs and influences decision-making across functions by enabling high-quality analytics, evidence-based decision support, development of dashboards and tools, and supporting operational needs.

Organizationally, you are part of the IBEX area ‚Äî and at the same time, you work closely with the sales, marketing, supporting functions, and senior leaders across the Swiss Marketing Company.

You Will Be Responsible For


Business Insights: Design, lead, and execute qualitative and quantitative strategic analysis initiatives to address key business questions related to commercial products and or operational data.
Competitive Intelligence: Proactively monitor industry, product, and competitors, economic trends, all on international, national, and regional levels.
Strategy Shaping: Contribute to the development/revision of market strategies and identify actionable insights based on data to sustainably accelerate business performance.
Forecasting: Build patient funnels and ambitious & reliable sales forecasts, and act as a partner and challenger for business.
Market Research: Conduct and consolidate market research to identify new opportunities, assess the competitive landscape, and support strategic planning.
Visualisations: Co-develop adequate Business Intelligence visualisations to transparently assess performance & benchmark across teams & geographies.
Performance Monitoring: Track and report on the performance across brands, identifying trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Customer Engagements & Sales Force Effectiveness: Define KPIs, analyse field and CRM engagement data, and deliver insights that sharpen targeting, channel mix, and next-best actions to drive SFE and customer engagement strategy.
Reporting: Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that deliver comprehensive insights into commercial performance in close collaboration with the cross-functional team
Process Improvement: Identify bottlenecks in commercial processes to increase efficiency and effectiveness in sales and marketing operations
Insight Communication: Present findings and insights to stakeholders and senior management with a high degree of accuracy and appropriate context, providing data-driven recommendations for business strategy.


Qualifications & Experience


Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Life Science, and/or Data Science, or related field; Master's preferred.
Experience: Minimum 3 years in business analytics and reporting or similar roles within the pharmaceutical sector (commercial experience is an advantage)
Skills:
Proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., SQL, Python, Tableau) and MS Office Suite
Demonstrated experience in user-centric dashboard design/development (e.g. Power BI)
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Fluency in English (German and/or French are nice to have)
Experience with CRM and data integration into Power BI (preferred)
Competencies:
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities with deep knowledge of data manipulation, harmonisation, and integration
Proven commercial acumen with the ability to link analytics to business outcomes, prioritise impact, and influence stakeholders with clear recommendations
High learning agility and ability to navigate ambiguity
High standards for data accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to changing priorities
Skilled at working effectively within cross-functional teams
Confidence in requirements gathering and stakeholder management at all levels
Ability to lead projects independently and communicate with leadership stakeholders

We offer

When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we fuel ambitious thinking with the power to encourage life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace, and challenge perceptions. That‚Äôs why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office.

But that doesn't mean we‚Äôre not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.

Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca, we are leading a transformation, fusing our digital and data capabilities with backing from the business to make it happen. We are leveraging our leading technologies and exploring data to make improved decisions and help the business to reach the right outcomes quickly. We are a diverse team of technical experts, each bringing something different to the table. What unites us is our dedicated desire to learn. We partner across the business, getting involved in projects early on to ensure the right technologies are implemented. We're recognised for the big contributions we make to AstraZeneca. As our data and digital capabilities expand every day, we know we're playing our part in accelerating AstraZeneca's growth.

Ready to make a difference? Apply now and join us in our mission to build a better future for patients worldwide!

Date Posted

09-Sept-2025

Closing Date

22-Sept-2025

AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.

At AstraZeneca, we are leading a transformation, fusing our digital and data capabilities with backing from the business to make it happen. We are leveraging our leading technologies and exploring data to make improved decisions and help the business to reach the right outcomes quickly. We are a diverse team of technical experts, each bringing something different to the table. What unites us is our dedicated desire to learn. We partner across the business, getting involved in projects early on to ensure the right technologies are implemented. We're recognised for the big contributions we make to AstraZeneca. As our data and digital capabilities expand every day, we know we're playing our part in accelerating AstraZeneca's growth.

Ready to make a difference? Apply now and join us in our mission to build a better future for patients worldwide!

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Model Validation Specialist?




Do you enjoy working on Independent Model Validation within Model Risk Management?




Then the role of Model Validation Specialist might be a good fit for you!




Our client, operating in the Financial Services industry, is looking for an expert to support them in the space of Independent Model Validation for regulatory compliance.




As a Model Validation Specialist, you will provide expertise in the domain of US withholding tax regulation (Section 871(m)), equity derivatives modelling, and quantitative analysis.




Setting: As part of the team, you will be focused on delivering the highest quality validation work, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, and producing clear, well-structured validation reports.




Focus: Independent validation of a model developed to determine the US withholding tax status of financial equity-linked instruments in line with Section 871(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.




Background: To succeed in this role, you will need prior experience in withholding tax regulations (US), equity derivatives product knowledge (including Greeks), and strong quantitative modelling skills.




Duration: This is an initial contract from 25.08.2025 to 31.10.2025 with the possibility of extension.




Workload: 80%




Location: Zurich.




For more information on this Model Validation Specialist opportunity or any other similar roles I am currently working on, please send your CV to:




üìß vuk.susa-stupar@nicollcurtin.com




üìû+41 43 508 26 71

Do you enjoy working on Independent Model Validation within Model Risk Management?


Then the role of Model Validation Specialist might be a good fit for you!


Our client, operating in the Financial Services industry, is looking for an expert to support them in the space of Independent Model Validation for regulatory compliance.


As a Model Validation Specialist, you will provide expertise in the domain of US withholding tax regulation (Section 871(m)), equity derivatives modelling, and quantitative analysis.


Setting: As part of the team, you will be focused on delivering the highest quality validation work, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, and producing clear, well-structured validation reports.


Focus: Independent validation of a model developed to determine the US withholding tax status of financial equity-linked instruments in line with Section 871(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.


Background: To succeed in this role, you will need prior experience in withholding tax regulations (US), equity derivatives product knowledge (including Greeks), and strong quantitative modelling skills.


Duration: This is an initial contract from 25.08.2025 to 31.10.2025 with the possibility of extension.


Workload: 80%


Location: Zurich.


For more information on this Model Validation Specialist opportunity or any other similar roles I am currently working on, please send your CV to:


üìß vuk.susa-stupar@nicollcurtin.com


üìû+41 43 508 26 71
