Title: Student assistant - analysis of research infrastructure
Description:
The swiss national science foundation (SNSF)




Thousands of scientists supported by the SNSF conduct research into nature, technology, and society. Their findings form the basis for progress. Our task is to select the best research ideas in national competitions. We are committed to promoting Switzerland as a strong research location and communicating the value of research. Become part of our team!




Student assistant - analysis of research infrastructure (m/w/d




The Long-Term Research sector is responsible at the SNSF for supporting certain research infrastructures and conducts evaluation mandates for infrastructures of national importance on behalf of the Confederation. As part of a federal mandate, it is developing a concept aimed at specifying its role in the evaluation and funding of infrastructures, complementing the efforts of higher education institutions, the Confederation, and the Academies. To support the preparation of this concept regarding the SNSF‚Äôs future responsibilities in research infrastructures, we identify model infrastructures and analyze their funding mechanisms for both development and operation.




Responsibilities




A list of approximately ten research infrastructures is established by the LTRI committee, which oversees the project at the Research Council level. For each infrastructure on this list, a ‚Äúcase study‚Äù analysis is conducted following a predefined framework:

Infrastructure characterization: Scientific domains, nature of services, user base, brief history of the creation and development of the infrastructure, recent examples of supported projects and a brief presentation of their results.
Infrastructure organization: Responsible institutions, partnerships (e.g., academic, industrial, or technological), governance and organizational chart, management and staff (organization, specializations).
Funding: Brief history of past funding (main phases, funding sources, encountered issues and key decisions), current funding (structure, processes, and attached conditions), monitoring and reporting.
Strategy and Development Perspectives: Brief SWOT analysis of the infrastructure, strategy and development plans, main challenges.




Qualifications




Strong interest and sensitivity for research management, particularly in relation to research infrastructure.
Basic training in economics and management is an asset.
Analytical and synthesis skills, ability to design and conduct specialized interviews (case study writing).
Working language: English.
Master‚Äôs level education or advanced Bachelor‚Äôs level are an asset
Basic training in economics and management is an asset.




What we offer




An exciting working environment at the interface of science, politics and international relations. The SNSF stands for equal opportunities, diversity and the promotion of innovative ideas in science. We offer you a responsible position with creative freedom, flexible working arrangements and attractive employment conditions.




Work package




We estimate that analyzing a case study takes on average 4 to 5 working days. An introductory session and an interview with infrastructure representatives are included for each case study. The person in charge of the project will support you throughout the task. We are looking for three people for this task, with a minimum of 3 infrastructures per person (12 working days). The analysis must be completed no later than October 31, 2025.




Contact




For more information, please contact St√©phanie Wyss (stephanie.wyss@snf.ch, responsible for the project) or Izzettin S√∂nmez, Talent Acquisition and Employer Branding Partner

Show more

Title: Intern Data Science
Description:
Internship Opportunity: Data Science (Advanced Analytics Team)

At Abbott, we believe in empowering people to live healthier, fuller lives. With a presence in over 160 countries and a diverse team of 114,000 colleagues, we‚Äôre committed to innovation in diagnostics, medical devices, nutrition, and pharmaceuticals.

We are looking for a curious, collaborative, and impact-driven Data Science Intern to join our Advanced Analytics team at EPD‚Äôs global headquarters in Basel. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to meaningful healthcare solutions while growing your skills in a supportive and inclusive environment.

Location: Allschwil-Basel, Switzerland

Duration: 6 months

Division: Abbott Established Pharmaceutical Division (EPD)

Why Join Us?


Purpose-Driven Work: Your contributions will help shape data-driven strategies that improve healthcare outcomes globally.
Inclusive Culture: We value diverse perspectives and foster a culture where everyone‚Äîregardless of gender, background, or experience‚Äîcan thrive.
Mentorship & Growth: You‚Äôll work closely with experienced data scientists and receive guidance to support your professional development.


What You‚Äôll Work On


Explore ways to reduce latency in LLMOps pipelines using techniques like model distillation, caching strategies, and prompt engineering.
Research and propose frameworks for automating repetitive tasks using multi-agent collaboration.
Collaborate with senior data scientists to understand business challenges across operations, finance, and supply chain.
Conduct data exploration, cleaning, and visualization to uncover insights.
Support model development workflows including feature engineering and validation.
Document findings to promote knowledge sharing and reproducibility.
Stay curious and continuously learn about emerging technologies in AI and data science.


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., applied mathematics, computer science, engineering, statistics).
Experience with full-cycle data science projects and applying methods to real-world problems.
Familiarity with tools like LangChain, Hugging Face, and vector databases.
Programming skills in Python or R; knowledge of object-oriented languages is a plus.
Understanding of software engineering principles and testing frameworks.
Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS/SageMaker is a bonus.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
Fluency in English; other languages are a plus.


We Encourage You To Apply If You


Are passionate about using data to solve meaningful problems.
Enjoy working in diverse teams and learning from others.
Want to grow your career in a supportive and innovative environment.


Ready to Make an Impact?

Send us your CV (PDF format) and show us how your curiosity and skills can help shape the future of healthcare. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Reference Data Analyst
Description:
Reference Data Analyst
______________________________________________________________________
Location: Zurich, Switzerland
Type: Full-time
Department: Financial Markets
_______________________________________________________________________
Summary
As a Reference Data Analyst you will be responsible for the accurate creation, maintenance, and governance of static and dynamic reference data across multiple financial products and systems.
This role plays a critical part in supporting collateral management operations by ensuring data integrity, timely updates, and alignment with regulatory and operational standards.
Responsibilities
- Maintain and validate reference data for counterparties, securities, and agreements used in collateral management systems and workflows.
- Set up accounts in Collateral Management Systems, ensuring alignment with CSAs, ISDA, and SMA agreements.
- Collaborate with middle office, risk, and legal teams to onboard new counterparties, secure approvals and update records.
- Liaise with external vendors (e.g., Bloomberg, Markit, DTCC) and internal stakeholders to source and verify data.
- Initiate and coordinate SSIs setup requests and coordinate with Ops teams and stakeholders.
- Address queries related to collateral accounts, SSIs setup.
- Plan and track client onboarding schedules, highlighting dependencies and risks.
- Maintain trackers and provide regular status updates in meetings and calls.
- Ensure timely coordination and escalation of issues/risks.
- Support additional or ad-hoc requests and projects.
- Adhere to operational controls (e.g. SOPs, SLAs, and KPIs).
- Participate in data quality initiatives, including exception reporting, root cause analysis, and remediation.
- Contribute to automation and process improvement efforts using tools such as Alteryx, Xceptor, or internal workflow engines.
- Ensure compliance with internal controls, audit requirements, and regulatory standards.
Eligibility Requirements
- Ideally, 1‚Äì5 years of experience in reference data management, preferably within collateral, middle office, or securities operations.
- Good understanding of financial instruments (e.g., OTC derivatives, equities, fixed income, FX) and collateral lifecycle.
- Ideally, familiarity with collateral management platforms (e.g., AcadiaSoft, TriResolve, Murex) and data governance tools.
- Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, lookups), with exposure to SQL or data visualisation tools being a plus.
- Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
- Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
- Preferred Qualifications - Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Economics, or a related field.
- Knowledge of regulatory frameworks impacting collateral and data.
- Experience with reconciliation tools and exception management workflows.

- Languages - German and/or English

- Work Permit - Must possess a Swiss Work Permit or a EU Passport

About eClerx
eClerx is a leading provider of productized services, bringing together people, technology and domain expertise to amplify business results.

The firm provides business process management, automation, and analytics services to a number of Fortune 2000 enterprises, including some of the world‚Äôs leading financial services, communications, retail, fashion, media & entertainment, manufacturing, travel & leisure, and technology companies. Incorporated in 2000, eClerx is traded on both the Bombay and National Stock Exchanges of India. The firm employs more than 19,000 people across Australia, Canada, France, Germany, Switzerland, Eqypt. India, Italy, Netherlands, Peru, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, the UK, and the USA.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across the company. As part of our central data team, you will collaborate closely with analysts from various Business Units and our data engineering team to ensure we have the highest quality data. Your analytical insights will directly influence the direction of our tools and key company objectives.

If you thrive on breaking down complexity into actionable tasks using data, are excited about working on innovative and fast-evolving ideas, and are passionate about leveraging data to protect and enhance privacy for millions of users worldwide, we would love to hear from you!

What You Will Do



Design and visualise new KPIs capturing product success and actionable insights able to uncover new opportunities.
Monitor and Synthesize KPIs to create reports capturing key company and cross-product level insights, challenging the status quo.
Translate company-level goals into analytical tasks to ensure a data-driven approach.
Collaborate closely with engineering teams to increase the quality and usability of our data within a privacy-first ecosystem.
Mentor junior team members on statistical techniques and exploratory data analysis to achieve the right balance of analytical proficiency and business impact.
Maintain and improve our A/B testing framework within our privacy-first in-house tool used by all data analysts to evaluate and document A/B tests.
Empower stakeholders to make data-driven decisions by developing training sessions on how to use and extract insights from our dashboards.



Job Requirements



Minimum 6 years' work experience as a Data Analyst with focus on statistics, data exploration and visualisation.
Solid statistical background and experience in conducting hypothesis testing, A/B analysis and exploratory analysis.
Ability to work large business concepts into actionable analytical tasks, including handling uncertainty and open-ended problems.
Excellent knowledge of SQL and at least one programming language, preferably Python.
Proven track record of prioritizing effectively and working independently in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
Great communication skills, with the ability to adapt to both technical and non-technical audiences to achieve results.



Bonus points for:



Previous experience mentoring team members.
Hands on experience with Metabase, Clickhouse, Git and Spark.
Previous experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) products and data privacy applications



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across the company. As part of our central data team, you will collaborate closely with analysts from various Business Units and our data engineering team to ensure we have the highest quality data. Your analytical insights will directly influence the direction of our tools and key company objectives.

If you thrive on breaking down complexity into actionable tasks using data, are excited about working on innovative and fast-evolving ideas, and are passionate about leveraging data to protect and enhance privacy for millions of users worldwide, we would love to hear from you!

What You Will Do


  • Design and visualise new KPIs capturing product success and actionable insights able to uncover new opportunities.
  • Monitor and Synthesize KPIs to create reports capturing key company and cross-product level insights, challenging the status quo.
  • Translate company-level goals into analytical tasks to ensure a data-driven approach.
  • Collaborate closely with engineering teams to increase the quality and usability of our data within a privacy-first ecosystem.
  • Mentor junior team members on statistical techniques and exploratory data analysis to achieve the right balance of analytical proficiency and business impact.
  • Maintain and improve our A/B testing framework within our privacy-first in-house tool used by all data analysts to evaluate and document A/B tests.
  • Empower stakeholders to make data-driven decisions by developing training sessions on how to use and extract insights from our dashboards.


Job Requirements


  • Minimum 6 years' work experience as a Data Analyst with focus on statistics, data exploration and visualisation.
  • Solid statistical background and experience in conducting hypothesis testing, A/B analysis and exploratory analysis.
  • Ability to work large business concepts into actionable analytical tasks, including handling uncertainty and open-ended problems.
  • Excellent knowledge of SQL and at least one programming language, preferably Python.
  • Proven track record of prioritizing effectively and working independently in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
  • Great communication skills, with the ability to adapt to both technical and non-technical audiences to achieve results.


Bonus points for:


  • Previous experience mentoring team members.
  • Hands on experience with Metabase, Clickhouse, Git and Spark.
  • Previous experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) products and data privacy applications


What We Offer


  • Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
  • Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
  • Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
  • Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
  • Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
  • Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
  • Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
  • Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
  • Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management
Description:
Switzerland

Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management

Organization


International Organization for Migration


Posted 1 Sep 2025 Closing date 11 Sep 2025

Job Identification (Reference Number): 16354

Position Title: Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management

Duty Station City: Geneva

Duty Station Country: Switzerland

Classification: Intern, Grade Other

Type of Appointment : Internship, four months with possibility of extension

Closing date: 11 September 2025

Introduction

Established in 1951, IOM is a Related Organization of the United Nations, and as the leading UN agency in the field of migration, works closely with governmental, intergovernmental and non-governmental partners. IOM is dedicated to promoting humane and orderly migration for the benefit of all. It does so by providing services and advice to governments and migrants.

Context

IOM established the Global Data Institute to harness the power of its data for operations, making meaning of global migration patterns, and providing foresight. The Global Data Institute capitalizes on synergies between its two units--the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) and the Global Migration Data Analysis Center (GMDAC)--and collaborates with a network of regional data specialists to illuminate the global data story of human mobility.

The Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) has been IOM‚Äôs main operational tool for tracking and monitoring the movements and evolving needs of displaced populations since 2004. It has been systematically deployed in medium to large-scale humanitarian response operations in the last four years, including in all Level 3 emergencies. As of 2023, DTM was active in 100 countries, tracking and monitoring over 57 million IDPs.

Under the overall supervision of the Global DTM Coordinator and direct supervision of the Data Science Support Officer, the DTM Visualization and Data Management Intern will be responsible and accountable for providing support to the activities and services provided by DTM support team in headquarters for DTM implementation in the field worldwide, to support development and implementation of supplementary and interoperable systems for quality assurance and further improvement of global DTM data and analysis.

Responsibilities

Technical


Utilization of relevant business intelligent tool for interpreting and analysing raw data into meaningful information and key findings.
Visualizing data, designing, and creating reports for accessibility in compliance with the DTM standards


Teamwork


Provide support to ensure standards in published DTM data on IOM websites, primarily displacement.iom.int, but may include any other portal as required by operations and global developments.
Implement data quality control mechanisms for DTM operations worldwide as set by the global standard.
Contribute to the implementation and roll out of responsible data mechanisms in DTM implementation worldwide. This includes the aspect of data governance, data protection, data security, and ethics in the collection and use of DTM data.
Support the development and adaptation of standard operating procedures for DTM field data collection and management.
Support the implementation of global DTM survey, tracking system for DTM operations worldwide, as well as addressing queries on data collected by DTM field operations, based on data consolidated in the Central Data Warehouse and any other databases available.
Support the development and implementation of Kobo forms to support DTM field operations worldwide.
Perform any other tasks as assigned.


Training Components and Learning Elements


Gain a thorough understanding of DTM methodologies, forms development and data management at DTM.
Develop technical knowledge of DTM data quality standards and tools used to support DTM operations at global, regional and country levels.
Gain a good understanding of humanitarian data collection and the use of data collection, management and analysis tools in the context of emergencies.
Develop communication skills to analyze, report and present on status, challenges and solutions related to data collection and management at country level.


Qualifications

Education


Pursuing degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Analytics or related field; with two years of relevant professional experience. Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured.


Accredited Universities are those listed in the UNESCO World Higher Education Database.

Experience


Knowledge of databases management, querying, quality assurance and control systems. Additional work experience is an advantage;
Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured;
Experience in the development and implementation of the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) or similar assessment and information management activities; and,
Experience in building interactive dashboards using Microsoft Power BI and/or Tableau is preferred.


Skills


Good data visualization skills in HTML5 or JavaScript environments; experience with AngularJS, NodeJS, or D3 is a plus;
Valued proficiency in using two or more of the following tools: XLS forms for ODK or Kobo, Microsoft Access, Python, Stata, or R;
Strong skills in working with relational databases, including SQL and/or Azure SQL, particularly for managing survey data;
Excellent communication skills, with a high degree of efficiency and adaptability;
Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage multiple tasks;
Strong attention to detail, commitment to data quality, and ability to meet tight deadlines; and,
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with a creative approach to data interpretation and visualization


Languages

For this position, fluency in English and Spanish is required (oral and written). Working knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, French, Chinese, and Spanish) is an advantage.

IOM‚Äôs official languages are English, French and Spanish. All staff members are required to be fluent in one of the the three languages.

Proficiency of language(s) required will be specifically evaluated during the selection process, which may include written and/or oral assessments

Note

Eligibility and Selection

In general, the Internship Programme aims at attracting talented students and graduates who:


have a specific interest in, or whose studies have covered, areas relevant to IOM programmes and activities;
are holding a scholarship for internship placements in international organizations and/or for whom internship is required to complete their studies; or
are sponsored by governmental/non governmental institutions and/or academia to work in specific areas relevant to both IOM and the sponsor.
are either enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor‚Äôs level or equivalent) or have graduated in the last 12 months.
are between 20 and 36 years of age.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and additional enquiries will only be addressed if the candidate is shortlisted.
Depending on experience and location, IOM provides a small monthly stipend to help offset costs.
Please consider the cost of living in the duty station prior to applying.


Required Competencies

IOM‚Äôs competency framework can be found at this link Competencies will be assessed during the selection process.

Values - all IOM staff members must abide by and demonstrate these values:


Inclusion and respect for diversity: Respects and promotes individual and cultural differences. Encourages diversity and inclusion.
Integrity and transparency: Maintains high ethical standards and acts in a manner consistent with organizational principles/rules and standards of conduct.
Professionalism: Demonstrates ability to work in a composed, competent and committed manner and exercises careful judgment in meeting day-to-day challenges.
Courage: Demonstrates willingness to take a stand on issues of importance.
Empathy: Shows compassion for others, makes people feel safe, respected and fairly treated.


Core Competencies ‚Äì behavioural indicators


Teamwork: Develops and promotes effective collaboration within and across units to achieve shared goals and optimize results.
Delivering results: Produces and delivers quality results in a service-oriented and timely manner. Is action oriented and committed to achieving agreed outcomes.
Managing and sharing knowledge: Continuously seeks to learn, share knowledge and innovate.
Accountability: Takes ownership for achieving the Organization‚Äôs priorities and assumes responsibility for own actions and delegated work.
Communication: Encourages and contributes to clear and open communication. Explains complex matters in an informative, inspiring and motivational way.


How to apply

To apply, interested applicants are invited to submit their applications HERE via the IOM Career Gateways by 11 September 2025.

Switzerland

Title: Internship Global Master Data Analyst 80-100% (m/f/d)
Description:
Switzerland, Visp

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there‚Äôs no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that‚Äôs the kind of work we want to be part of.

Key Responsibilities

The Master Data department in Visp is a global team responsible for the development of master data processes and standards that are to be followed by the whole organization. As an intern, you will play an active role in:


Perform various data analyses and reports to support Master data or Business projects
Assisting with SAP Master Data mass maintenance and migration efforts
Gathering feedback from global and local Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) across the organization
Defining functional and technical requirements for the development or enhancement of Master Data processes
Updating and improving training materials, and delivering hands-on training sessions to teams across Lonza


As a part of the Global Master Data team, you will be able to learn SAP Materials Management (MM), Production & Planning (PP) and Sales & Distribution (SD) modules, key business processes as well as SAP data structures. Overall, you will interact with many different departments and experts across the company worldwide.

Key Requirements


A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent experience) in data science, computer science, business information technology, or mathematics
Solid understanding of data structures or hands-on experience with databases
Proficiency in English; German and other languages are a valuable plus
A passion for optimizing processes, improving IT tools, and exploring innovative solutions
You are interested in being a reliable team member in a multi-cultural environment.


Every day, Lonza‚Äôs products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Specialist ‚Äì CDO Global Black Belt
Description:
Microsoft‚Äôs Commercial Solution Area (CSA) sets the sales strategy, leads technical sales, and operations as a hub for the Commercial Solution Areas and Support Services that power the Microsoft Cloud. Data & Analytics is a growth opportunity for Microsoft Azure, as well as its partners and customers. It includes a rich portfolio of products providing unified Data Platform supporting customers‚Äô Data needs in the era and AI.

The Azure Global Black Belt (GBB) Cloud & AI Data Specialist is a pivotal role in building trust with the Chief Data Officers (CDOs) of our customers, guiding them to build the Data Foundations for their companies‚Äô AI Transformation and influencing them to standardize on the Microsoft Intelligent Data platform. This role is crucial for driving the adoption of Azure Data & AI Services, with a particular focus on the MACC (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment) accounts.

The role engages with CDOs of our largest accounts and accounts in complex competitive situations, documenting best practices and learnings. The role also involves guiding the broader field on the winning formulas for successful CDO engagements.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Accelerate Data & AI growth while influencing Product Excellence and Go-To-Market with the insights and experiences from these engagements.


Strategic Relationships: Establish trusted advisor relationships with senior business and technology executives (CDO, CIO, CISO, CTO) in top accounts by consistently delivering value through Azure-led innovation, while amplifying Microsoft‚Äôs thought leadership by actively shaping and participating in CDO community forums, executive panels, and strategic storytelling platforms.
Drive Data & AI Platform Standardization:‚ÄØInfluence CDOs to standardize on the Microsoft Data & AI platforms end-to-end, across their Analytics platform, Data Governance, and Databases to support their companies‚Äô AI transformation.
Accelerate Azure Data Services Growth:‚ÄØDrive the increase of Azure Data Services share in key accounts, with a focus on MACC accounts. Key outcome: Increase ADS (Azure Data Services) share of ACR (Azure Consumed Revenue) in MACC agreements / MACC accounts, win new MACCs (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitments).
Remove blockers and accelerate sales: Identify and resolve roadblocks that may hinder customer progress, bring values into deal strategy to assist sellers with deep expertise in top partner offerings globally, capacity and pricing/SKU/model, use case scenarios, process, business value articulation for assigned specialization area.
Win Over Competitors & Business Commitment: Expert in compete coaching against major Public Cloud Hyper Scalers competitors by defining winning competitive strategies (win back, surround), demonstrating superior solutions and securing business commitment.
Incubation to Mainstream: Spot repeatable patterns in sales motions (e.g., commercial constructs, customer scenarios) and scale them across the field.
Sales Strategy Feedback Loop: Working with Go-To-Market team to capture insights from customer engagements and field feedback to identify sales patterns, blockers, and opportunities. Share these insights with MCAPS to help shape better sales strategies that continuously meet customer needs and field realities.
Knowledge Transfer to Sales Roles:‚ÄØWork with enablement team as a scale mechanism to skill specialist, specialist managers, and sales leaders through deal coaching, structured knowledge sharing, and training.
Thought Leadership:‚ÄØBe a leading industry expert and drive awareness and adoption through speaking at events, publishing articles, and sharing best practices.


Key Outcomes


Increase ADS share of ACR in MACC agreements / MACC accounts.
Enhanced consistency and effectiveness in CDO engagements across the timezone.
Documented best practices and winning formulas for CDO engagements.
Successful execution of Data & AI solution plays, driving business growth and customer success.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs):


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration,
OR related field AND growing experience in technology-related sales or account management;
OR highly experienced in technology-related sales or account management
Significant experience leading the sales of large cloud engagements, especially those involving Data, Analytics and AI solutions to large/global enterprise customers.

Additional Or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Sales Account Planning and Management: Strong and disciplined pipeline management, identification and analysis of customer usage trends, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation experience, understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.
Executive Presence: Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the business value and cost savings of the solution to the customer‚Äôs overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
Collaborative: Orchestrate and influence virtual sales/technical/support/partner teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead virtual teams through influence.
Consumption Business Strategy / Project Management: Experience leveraging cloud adoption methodologies and frameworks to structure application migration projects.
Deep understanding of the Microsoft Data platform and Azure Data and AI Services.
Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud & AI competitor landscape including AWS and GCP.
Microsoft Partners: Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.

For Austria Only: The salary for this role is starting from EURO 182,600 per annum depending on experience.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

The Azure Global Black Belt (GBB) Cloud & AI Data Specialist is a pivotal role in building trust with the Chief Data Officers (CDOs) of our customers, guiding them to build the Data Foundations for their companies‚Äô AI Transformation and influencing them to standardize on the Microsoft Intelligent Data platform. This role is crucial for driving the adoption of Azure Data & AI Services, with a particular focus on the MACC (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment) accounts.

The role engages with CDOs of our largest accounts and accounts in complex competitive situations, documenting best practices and learnings. The role also involves guiding the broader field on the winning formulas for successful CDO engagements.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Accelerate Data & AI growth while influencing Product Excellence and Go-To-Market with the insights and experiences from these engagements.

  • Strategic Relationships: Establish trusted advisor relationships with senior business and technology executives (CDO, CIO, CISO, CTO) in top accounts by consistently delivering value through Azure-led innovation, while amplifying Microsoft‚Äôs thought leadership by actively shaping and participating in CDO community forums, executive panels, and strategic storytelling platforms.
  • Drive Data & AI Platform Standardization:‚ÄØInfluence CDOs to standardize on the Microsoft Data & AI platforms end-to-end, across their Analytics platform, Data Governance, and Databases to support their companies‚Äô AI transformation.
  • Accelerate Azure Data Services Growth:‚ÄØDrive the increase of Azure Data Services share in key accounts, with a focus on MACC accounts. Key outcome: Increase ADS (Azure Data Services) share of ACR (Azure Consumed Revenue) in MACC agreements / MACC accounts, win new MACCs (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitments).
  • Remove blockers and accelerate sales: Identify and resolve roadblocks that may hinder customer progress, bring values into deal strategy to assist sellers with deep expertise in top partner offerings globally, capacity and pricing/SKU/model, use case scenarios, process, business value articulation for assigned specialization area.
  • Win Over Competitors & Business Commitment: Expert in compete coaching against major Public Cloud Hyper Scalers competitors by defining winning competitive strategies (win back, surround), demonstrating superior solutions and securing business commitment.
  • Incubation to Mainstream: Spot repeatable patterns in sales motions (e.g., commercial constructs, customer scenarios) and scale them across the field.
  • Sales Strategy Feedback Loop: Working with Go-To-Market team to capture insights from customer engagements and field feedback to identify sales patterns, blockers, and opportunities. Share these insights with MCAPS to help shape better sales strategies that continuously meet customer needs and field realities.
  • Knowledge Transfer to Sales Roles:‚ÄØWork with enablement team as a scale mechanism to skill specialist, specialist managers, and sales leaders through deal coaching, structured knowledge sharing, and training.
  • Thought Leadership:‚ÄØBe a leading industry expert and drive awareness and adoption through speaking at events, publishing articles, and sharing best practices.

Key Outcomes

  • Increase ADS share of ACR in MACC agreements / MACC accounts.
  • Enhanced consistency and effectiveness in CDO engagements across the timezone.
  • Documented best practices and winning formulas for CDO engagements.
  • Successful execution of Data & AI solution plays, driving business growth and customer success.

Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs):

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration,
    • OR related field AND growing experience in technology-related sales or account management;
    • OR highly experienced in technology-related sales or account management
  • Significant experience leading the sales of large cloud engagements, especially those involving Data, Analytics and AI solutions to large/global enterprise customers.
Additional Or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)

  • Sales Account Planning and Management: Strong and disciplined pipeline management, identification and analysis of customer usage trends, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation experience, understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.
    • Executive Presence: Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the business value and cost savings of the solution to the customer‚Äôs overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
    • Collaborative: Orchestrate and influence virtual sales/technical/support/partner teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead virtual teams through influence.
  • Consumption Business Strategy / Project Management: Experience leveraging cloud adoption methodologies and frameworks to structure application migration projects.
  • Deep understanding of the Microsoft Data platform and Azure Data and AI Services.
    • Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud & AI competitor landscape including AWS and GCP.
    • Microsoft Partners: Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.
For Austria Only: The salary for this role is starting from EURO 182,600 per annum depending on experience.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data Specialist ‚Äì CDO Global Black Belt
Description:
Microsoft‚Äôs Commercial Solution Area (CSA) sets the sales strategy, leads technical sales, and operations as a hub for the Commercial Solution Areas and Support Services that power the Microsoft Cloud. Data & Analytics is a growth opportunity for Microsoft Azure, as well as its partners and customers. It includes a rich portfolio of products providing unified Data Platform supporting customers‚Äô Data needs in the era and AI.

The Azure Global Black Belt (GBB) Cloud & AI Data Specialist is a pivotal role in building trust with the Chief Data Officers (CDOs) of our customers, guiding them to build the Data Foundations for their companies‚Äô AI Transformation and influencing them to standardize on the Microsoft Intelligent Data platform. This role is crucial for driving the adoption of Azure Data & AI Services, with a particular focus on the MACC (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment) accounts.

The role engages with CDOs of our largest accounts and accounts in complex competitive situations, documenting best practices and learnings. The role also involves guiding the broader field on the winning formulas for successful CDO engagements.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Accelerate Data & AI growth while influencing Product Excellence and Go-To-Market with the insights and experiences from these engagements.


Strategic Relationships: Establish trusted advisor relationships with senior business and technology executives (CDO, CIO, CISO, CTO) in top accounts by consistently delivering value through Azure-led innovation, while amplifying Microsoft‚Äôs thought leadership by actively shaping and participating in CDO community forums, executive panels, and strategic storytelling platforms.
Drive Data & AI Platform Standardization:‚ÄØInfluence CDOs to standardize on the Microsoft Data & AI platforms end-to-end, across their Analytics platform, Data Governance, and Databases to support their companies‚Äô AI transformation.
Accelerate Azure Data Services Growth:‚ÄØDrive the increase of Azure Data Services share in key accounts, with a focus on MACC accounts. Key outcome: Increase ADS (Azure Data Services) share of ACR (Azure Consumed Revenue) in MACC agreements / MACC accounts, win new MACCs (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitments).
Remove blockers and accelerate sales: Identify and resolve roadblocks that may hinder customer progress, bring values into deal strategy to assist sellers with deep expertise in top partner offerings globally, capacity and pricing/SKU/model, use case scenarios, process, business value articulation for assigned specialization area.
Win Over Competitors & Business Commitment: Expert in compete coaching against major Public Cloud Hyper Scalers competitors by defining winning competitive strategies (win back, surround), demonstrating superior solutions and securing business commitment.
Incubation to Mainstream: Spot repeatable patterns in sales motions (e.g., commercial constructs, customer scenarios) and scale them across the field.
Sales Strategy Feedback Loop: Working with Go-To-Market team to capture insights from customer engagements and field feedback to identify sales patterns, blockers, and opportunities. Share these insights with MCAPS to help shape better sales strategies that continuously meet customer needs and field realities.
Knowledge Transfer to Sales Roles:‚ÄØWork with enablement team as a scale mechanism to skill specialist, specialist managers, and sales leaders through deal coaching, structured knowledge sharing, and training.
Thought Leadership:‚ÄØBe a leading industry expert and drive awareness and adoption through speaking at events, publishing articles, and sharing best practices.


Key Outcomes


Increase ADS share of ACR in MACC agreements / MACC accounts.
Enhanced consistency and effectiveness in CDO engagements across the timezone.
Documented best practices and winning formulas for CDO engagements.
Successful execution of Data & AI solution plays, driving business growth and customer success.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs):


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration,
OR related field AND growing experience in technology-related sales or account management;
OR highly experienced in technology-related sales or account management
Significant experience leading the sales of large cloud engagements, especially those involving Data, Analytics and AI solutions to large/global enterprise customers.

Additional Or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Sales Account Planning and Management: Strong and disciplined pipeline management, identification and analysis of customer usage trends, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation experience, understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.
Executive Presence: Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the business value and cost savings of the solution to the customer‚Äôs overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
Collaborative: Orchestrate and influence virtual sales/technical/support/partner teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead virtual teams through influence.
Consumption Business Strategy / Project Management: Experience leveraging cloud adoption methodologies and frameworks to structure application migration projects.
Deep understanding of the Microsoft Data platform and Azure Data and AI Services.
Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud & AI competitor landscape including AWS and GCP.
Microsoft Partners: Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.

For Austria Only: The salary for this role is starting from EURO 182,600 per annum depending on experience.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Engineer Intern
Description:
Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:


EU / EEA citizenship
Must be graduating within or after November 2025


These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let‚Äôs talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:


Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.


What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?


Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.


Competences Required:


Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.


A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.

We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:


The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.


What‚Äôs In It For You

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential‚Äîfueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people‚Äîyou can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:


Participate in dedicated skill-building workshops
Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership


In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:


A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands


Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

ARE YOU IN? Apply now ‚Äì early application increases your chances!

R-20250710-0008
Show more

In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:

  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
  • An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
  • Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
  • On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
  • A discount card with 50% on all VF brands

Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

ARE YOU IN? Apply now ‚Äì early application increases your chances!

R-20250710-0008

Title: SENIOR BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
Description:
DonTouch SA is a digital company based in Switzerland that operates some of the largest marketplaces in Europe: Italy, Spain, Germany, and the UK.

With over 60,000 paying advertisers annually, our properties reach more than 7 million unique monthly active users, across the web and mobile apps for both iOS and Android.

For our Headquarters in Chiasso (CH), we are hiring:

SENIOR BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST

(NO REMOTE)

For this position we are looking for a professional accustomed to making technological decisions and managing requests from various departments based on business priorities and needs.

This role requires combining strong analytical skills with knowledge and experience in Business Intelligence solutions, with excellent written and verbal communication skills, to interact clearly and convincingly with cross-functional stakeholders.

The ideal profile is able to work closely with key stakeholders (mainly at C-level) to create systematic insights, data visualization, intuitive dashboards and data modeling to support strategically analysis in decision-making processes.

An innovative and open-minded individual, able to work independently and and in fruitful collaboration with the team

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders (Sales, Marketing, Finance, ICT) to capture requirements, policies and procedures for the collection and analysis, develop tools, processes, and best practices for continuous data collection, analysis, massive outputs, and presentations/reports.
Cooperate with ICT Department to implement software and hardware upgrades to leverage big data use cases
Build and iterate dashboards for Revenue/Pipeline, Marketing Performance (ROAS, CAC, LTV, attribution), and Customer360 with solid UX and governance.
Design and develop LOOK ML (views, joins, explores, refinements/extends) and define reusable measures/dimensions.
Performance & governance: PDTs/Aggregate Awareness, datagroups/cache, query optimization; implement RLS via user attributes and folder permissions.
Own the KPI Catalog (definitions, business rules, owners, granularity) and maintain documentation/playbooks.
Implement new data procurement and data analysis
Implement new techniques and technologies, data visualization and modeling, trend identification
Balance the line between ICT and the business:
Programming, data modeling and statistics
Analytical thinking and problem-solving
Communication
Monitor analytics and metrics results
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in information systems, computer science, data science, engineering, or a related field
5 + years of work experience Database and data architecture design
5 + years of experience in Data Warehouse Business Intelligence
Deep Knowledge of BI principles, Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, Data Modelling and reporting tools
Deep expertise with Looker and LookML (explores, joins, reusable views, PDTs/aggregate tables, datagroups, user attributes/RLS, performance tuning).
Exposure to web analytics and MarTech (Matomo, Mautic/CRM, Ads APIs/platforms).
Power BI for creating charts, graphs and other data visualizations
Strong SQL and dimensional data modeling (facts/dimensions)
Experience with Dataform/dbt on BigQuery (tests, documentation, CI/CD)
Cost governance on BigQuery (materializations, partitions, aggregate tables)
Proficient in ETL - extract, transform, load (e.g., Airbyte)
Hands‚Äëon delivery for Sales/Marketing/Finance analytics
Ability to define and compute KPI such as ROAS, CAC, LTV, ARPU/ARPA, pipeline metrics
Familiarity with attribution (last‚Äëclick and position‚Äëbased 40/20/40)
Excellent knowledge of the most common end-user tools (Excel) and DBMS‚Äôs (SQL, Elastic, Redis, Postgres)
Practical experience with programming languages for extracting and manipulating data sets (Python, SQL, R, etc.)
A/B testing basics and statistics
Critical thinking and problem-solving
A good understanding of business practices
Excellent communication skills
Leadership and project management experience
Git workflows



TECH STACK


LOOK ML
BigQuery, Looker, Dataform/dbt, Airbyte, Matomo, Mautic/CRM, Power BI, Ads platforms (Google/Meta),Python, Git.



LANGUAGES

ITALIAN Fluent (verbally and written)

ENGLISH Fluent (verbally and written)

Additional Languages will be considered a plus.

Benefits and Values - What you can expect from us:

TRAINING: You will work with an experienced and dynamic team, with whom you will grow and expand your professional skills.

VALORISATION: Proactive people with initiative are in our interest: your proposals will always be taken into consideration and, if feasible, we will be happy to put them into practice together.

CONCRETE: We offer a concrete opportunity for professional growth that will allow you to discover and come into direct contact with the challenges and fascination of an unconventional sector related to the digital world. The contract and RAL will be commensurate with experience.

TECHNOLOGY: Technology is the basis of our structure; we provide the necessary supports to perform the activities to the best of our ability. When you arrive, you will find Microsoft or Apple technical equipment at your workstation, depending on the tasks to be performed.

ENVIRONMENTS: Facility equipped with areas for conviviality among colleagues with free coffee and drinks.

Dontouch SA is an equal opportunity employer.

Contract: Permanent employment contract according to Swiss Law (equal to 40 hours per week).

Job location: Chiasso, Canton Ticino (Switzerland) - NO REMOTE

You can apply on LinkedIn or send your CV to hr@dontouch.ch

Please specify the type of projects in which the above-mentioned skills were used.

Applications whose profiles do not meet the above requirements will not be considered.


For non-EU/AELS citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss work permit, DonTouch cannot guarantee your final employment due to authority regulations.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.
