Title: Working Student PowerBI Development and Data Analytics 40-60%
Description:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow

Siemens Smart Infrastructure combines the real and digital worlds across energy systems, buildings and industries, enhancing the way people live and work and significantly improving efficiency and sustainability.

Together, we create an impact

We work together with customers and partners to create an ecosystem that both intuitively responds to the needs of people and helps customers achieve their business goals. It helps our customers to thrive, communities to progress and supports sustainable development to protect our planet for the next generation.

As a working student, intern or trainee, you are an important part of our #TeamSiemens Switzerland. We offer a flexible and open workplace culture for an optimal balance between studies, work and private life, so that your work-life balance is sure to be good. As a member of the Siemens Student Association, you will have regular opportunities to exchange ideas with your community and expand your network. And who knows: perhaps national or international career opportunities will open up for you with us after your studies.

Why not find out for yourself and see what other working students have to say about their experience at Siemens?

Your New Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain interactive PowerBI dashboards and reports to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) and operational metrics for our SaaS business
Collaborate closely with key stakeholders across R&D, Finance, Quality, and other domains to understand their data challenges and priorities. Translate these insights into impactful dashboard solutions that empower data-driven decision-making across the organization
Apply best practices in data visualization and user experience to ensure dashboards are intuitive, actionable, and support data-driven decision-making.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data infrastructure and reporting capabilities
Manage and version control PowerBI assets and related scripts using GitLab
Support in connecting to various data sources, performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, ensuring data accuracy and consistency
Contribute to implementing complex DAX formulas and M-queries to create robust data models and insightful calculations


Your Talents And Experience


You are currently enrolled pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, Business Informatics, or a related quantitative field or University of Applied Sciences in Switzerland
1 to 2 years of experience with Microsoft PowerBI Desktop, or a strong interest and aptitude for learning its functionalities
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Basic understanding of software development processes and methodologies
Familiarity with version control systems, preferably GitLab
Proficiency in a programming language commonly used for data manipulation (e.g., Python, SQL, TypeScript) is a plus
You are a motivated and proactive student with excellent problem-solving skills and a dedicated, results-oriented work style
Fluent in English is a must, knowledge of German will be a benefit in this role


Employee Benefits


Mobile working from anywhere within Switzerland
Opportunity to develop an international professional network
Gain experience at one of the largest tech employers in Switzerland
Membership in the Siemens Students Association comprising 200 members


What It‚Äôs Like Working For Us

We place significant emphasis on fostering an inclusive and flexible working culture that encourages everyone to be their authentic selves. Equal opportunities and diversity are important to us and contribute to an enriching corporate culture. We actively embrace mobile working to provide every colleague with more autonomy and the chance to achieve a good work-life balance. Learn more here

Are you a good fit?

Our culture at Siemens Switzerland is defined by more than just the working environment. It is the heart of our daily interactions and the key to our success. Do you have what it takes to become a Siemens employee? Take our quiz now and find out! Culture quiz

Frequently asked questions and contact information

Here you will find a collection of frequently asked questions and a way to contact us directly.

I look forward to receiving your application

Olger

Talent Acquisition Partner

Information for recruitment agencies: Siemens is not accepting applications from recruitment agencies for this position. Thank you for your understanding.
Show more
HTML:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow

Siemens Smart Infrastructure combines the real and digital worlds across energy systems, buildings and industries, enhancing the way people live and work and significantly improving efficiency and sustainability.

Together, we create an impact

We work together with customers and partners to create an ecosystem that both intuitively responds to the needs of people and helps customers achieve their business goals. It helps our customers to thrive, communities to progress and supports sustainable development to protect our planet for the next generation.

As a working student, intern or trainee, you are an important part of our #TeamSiemens Switzerland. We offer a flexible and open workplace culture for an optimal balance between studies, work and private life, so that your work-life balance is sure to be good. As a member of the Siemens Student Association, you will have regular opportunities to exchange ideas with your community and expand your network. And who knows: perhaps national or international career opportunities will open up for you with us after your studies.

Why not find out for yourself and see what other working students have to say about their experience at Siemens?

Your New Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain interactive PowerBI dashboards and reports to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) and operational metrics for our SaaS business
  • Collaborate closely with key stakeholders across R&D, Finance, Quality, and other domains to understand their data challenges and priorities. Translate these insights into impactful dashboard solutions that empower data-driven decision-making across the organization
  • Apply best practices in data visualization and user experience to ensure dashboards are intuitive, actionable, and support data-driven decision-making.
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data infrastructure and reporting capabilities
  • Manage and version control PowerBI assets and related scripts using GitLab
  • Support in connecting to various data sources, performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, ensuring data accuracy and consistency
  • Contribute to implementing complex DAX formulas and M-queries to create robust data models and insightful calculations

Your Talents And Experience

  • You are currently enrolled pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, Business Informatics, or a related quantitative field or University of Applied Sciences in Switzerland
  • 1 to 2 years of experience with Microsoft PowerBI Desktop, or a strong interest and aptitude for learning its functionalities
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Basic understanding of software development processes and methodologies
  • Familiarity with version control systems, preferably GitLab
  • Proficiency in a programming language commonly used for data manipulation (e.g., Python, SQL, TypeScript) is a plus
  • You are a motivated and proactive student with excellent problem-solving skills and a dedicated, results-oriented work style
  • Fluent in English is a must, knowledge of German will be a benefit in this role

Employee Benefits

  • Mobile working from anywhere within Switzerland
  • Opportunity to develop an international professional network
  • Gain experience at one of the largest tech employers in Switzerland
  • Membership in the Siemens Students Association comprising 200 members

What It‚Äôs Like Working For Us

We place significant emphasis on fostering an inclusive and flexible working culture that encourages everyone to be their authentic selves. Equal opportunities and diversity are important to us and contribute to an enriching corporate culture. We actively embrace mobile working to provide every colleague with more autonomy and the chance to achieve a good work-life balance. Learn more here

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Show more

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Mission


Core Banking - Contractor IT Business Analyst with strong functional & technical skills on Security, Settlements, Asset Servicing


Main responsibilities


Responsibilities

As a member of the Core Banking team in the IT department, the successful candidate as Core Banking Business Analyst will partner with the business and IT stakeholders on the acquistion projects related to core banking platform focusing on Security, Settlements, Asset Servicing. His/her main responsibilities would be the followings:


Compliance with UBP architecture, procedures and standards
Business Analysis and formalization of business needs on Security, Settlements, Asset Servicing
Definition and design of the solution along with SMEs and Service owners
Submit for approval analysis and specifications to Users
High level business requirements specification
High level development workload estimation


Requested Skills And Experience

Strong experience (over 15+ years) in banking industry

Experience with Operational Processes within Wealth Management


Strong IT delivery transformation experience
Seniority and good communication skills
Experience with core banking landscape in a bank or in software firm
Autonomous
Structured methodology
Capability to communicate in French and English (spoken and written ideal)
Client oriented
Capability to drive onshore/offshore teams
Education: Bachelor Degree

Strong experience (over 15+ years) in banking industry
Experience with Operational Processes within Wealth Management


Personal Skills


Autonomous
Structured methodology
Capability to communicate in French and English (spoken and written ideal)
Capacity to respect confidentiality of both the bank and the mission
Client oriented
Ability to work in a high-pressure environment given fixed timeframe


Practical


Others- Swiss Residence: Optional


Core Competencies : Adherence to the company‚Äôs values: Dedication, Conviction, Agility and Responsibility - Compliance with regulations and internal directives

Title: Data & AI Engineer (Remote ‚Äì Switzerland based)
Description:
About the job

Join MDW, a consulting firm specialized in Data, AI, and Business Applications, operating at the core of the Microsoft ecosystem.




We support leading Swiss companies in building secure, scalable, and future-ready platforms using Azure, Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, and Copilot Studio.

If you're passionate about working on high-impact data projects and want to grow in a dynamic, expert-driven environment this opportunity is for you.




Your responsibilities




Design and implement modern data platforms in cloud and hybrid environments
Build and optimize data pipelines using the Azure Data stack, Databricks, and open-source tools
Contribute to real-time architectures and lakehouse models
Collaborate with consultants and clients to bring innovation into production




Your profile




Experience in data engineering or AI solution delivery
Strong skills in Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Data Lake, Databricks, Python or PySpark
Familiar with CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, and architectures like Medallion or Fabric Eventhouse
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric, MLOps, or Generative AI is a strong plus
Fluent in French or English
Based in Switzerland




What we offer




Full remote work with flexible conditions
6 weeks of paid vacation per year
Competitive Swiss-level salary
Personalized career plan and continuous skills development
Access to Microsoft previews, early technologies, and strategic projects
A team of experts working on disruptive Data & AI solutions

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are currently seeking an experienced¬† Data Engineer¬†to join a leading bank in Switzerland. This exciting opportunity will involve helping one of Switzerland‚Äôs leading banks build, secure and optimise data pipelines to ensure reliable data flow across the business

The role requires¬†English language¬†skills, and candidates to be¬†based in Zurich or a commutable distance, as the role is hybrid.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines using Informatica PowerCenter/IDQ and Apache Spark.
Collaborate with business stakeholders, data analysts, and data scientists to gather requirements and translate them into scalable data solutions.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple banking domains (e.g., retail, risk, compliance, payments).
Implement best practices for data integration, quality, lineage, and governance to meet banking regulatory and compliance standards.
Optimise Spark jobs and workflows for performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.
Partner with infrastructure and cloud teams to support deployment and monitoring of data pipelines on-premises and/or in cloud environments (AWS/Azure/GCP).
Develop and maintain technical documentation, data dictionaries, and process workflows.
Support production operations by troubleshooting, resolving issues, and implementing preventive measures
¬†
Desirable Requirements:
¬†

Strong background in Data Engineering
Experience with Spark
Informatica experience
Python and SQL experience
¬†
The role offers the flexibility of a¬†hybrid work arrangement¬†and is a 6-12 month contract with possibility of extension.¬†
Show more
HTML:
We are currently seeking an experienced  Data Engineer to join a leading bank in Switzerland. This exciting opportunity will involve helping one of Switzerland‚Äôs leading banks build, secure and optimise data pipelines to ensure reliable data flow across the business

The role requires English language skills, and candidates to be based in Zurich or a commutable distance, as the role is hybrid.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines using Informatica PowerCenter/IDQ and Apache Spark.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders, data analysts, and data scientists to gather requirements and translate them into scalable data solutions.
  • Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple banking domains (e.g., retail, risk, compliance, payments).
  • Implement best practices for data integration, quality, lineage, and governance to meet banking regulatory and compliance standards.
  • Optimise Spark jobs and workflows for performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.
  • Partner with infrastructure and cloud teams to support deployment and monitoring of data pipelines on-premises and/or in cloud environments (AWS/Azure/GCP).
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation, data dictionaries, and process workflows.
  • Support production operations by troubleshooting, resolving issues, and implementing preventive measures
 
Desirable Requirements:
 
  • Strong background in Data Engineering
  • Experience with Spark
  • Informatica experience
  • Python and SQL experience
 
The role offers the flexibility of a hybrid work arrangement and is a 6-12 month contract with possibility of extension.

Title: Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management
Description:
Switzerland

Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management

Organization


International Organization for Migration


Posted 1 Sep 2025 Closing date 11 Sep 2025

Job Identification (Reference Number): 16354

Position Title: Intern - DTM Visualization and Data Management

Duty Station City: Geneva

Duty Station Country: Switzerland

Classification: Intern, Grade Other

Type of Appointment : Internship, four months with possibility of extension

Closing date: 11 September 2025

Introduction

Established in 1951, IOM is a Related Organization of the United Nations, and as the leading UN agency in the field of migration, works closely with governmental, intergovernmental and non-governmental partners. IOM is dedicated to promoting humane and orderly migration for the benefit of all. It does so by providing services and advice to governments and migrants.

Context

IOM established the Global Data Institute to harness the power of its data for operations, making meaning of global migration patterns, and providing foresight. The Global Data Institute capitalizes on synergies between its two units--the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) and the Global Migration Data Analysis Center (GMDAC)--and collaborates with a network of regional data specialists to illuminate the global data story of human mobility.

The Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) has been IOM‚Äôs main operational tool for tracking and monitoring the movements and evolving needs of displaced populations since 2004. It has been systematically deployed in medium to large-scale humanitarian response operations in the last four years, including in all Level 3 emergencies. As of 2023, DTM was active in 100 countries, tracking and monitoring over 57 million IDPs.

Under the overall supervision of the Global DTM Coordinator and direct supervision of the Data Science Support Officer, the DTM Visualization and Data Management Intern will be responsible and accountable for providing support to the activities and services provided by DTM support team in headquarters for DTM implementation in the field worldwide, to support development and implementation of supplementary and interoperable systems for quality assurance and further improvement of global DTM data and analysis.

Responsibilities

Technical


Utilization of relevant business intelligent tool for interpreting and analysing raw data into meaningful information and key findings.
Visualizing data, designing, and creating reports for accessibility in compliance with the DTM standards


Teamwork


Provide support to ensure standards in published DTM data on IOM websites, primarily displacement.iom.int, but may include any other portal as required by operations and global developments.
Implement data quality control mechanisms for DTM operations worldwide as set by the global standard.
Contribute to the implementation and roll out of responsible data mechanisms in DTM implementation worldwide. This includes the aspect of data governance, data protection, data security, and ethics in the collection and use of DTM data.
Support the development and adaptation of standard operating procedures for DTM field data collection and management.
Support the implementation of global DTM survey, tracking system for DTM operations worldwide, as well as addressing queries on data collected by DTM field operations, based on data consolidated in the Central Data Warehouse and any other databases available.
Support the development and implementation of Kobo forms to support DTM field operations worldwide.
Perform any other tasks as assigned.


Training Components and Learning Elements


Gain a thorough understanding of DTM methodologies, forms development and data management at DTM.
Develop technical knowledge of DTM data quality standards and tools used to support DTM operations at global, regional and country levels.
Gain a good understanding of humanitarian data collection and the use of data collection, management and analysis tools in the context of emergencies.
Develop communication skills to analyze, report and present on status, challenges and solutions related to data collection and management at country level.


Qualifications

Education


Pursuing degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Analytics or related field; with two years of relevant professional experience. Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured.


Accredited Universities are those listed in the UNESCO World Higher Education Database.

Experience


Knowledge of databases management, querying, quality assurance and control systems. Additional work experience is an advantage;
Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured;
Experience in the development and implementation of the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) or similar assessment and information management activities; and,
Experience in building interactive dashboards using Microsoft Power BI and/or Tableau is preferred.


Skills


Good data visualization skills in HTML5 or JavaScript environments; experience with AngularJS, NodeJS, or D3 is a plus;
Valued proficiency in using two or more of the following tools: XLS forms for ODK or Kobo, Microsoft Access, Python, Stata, or R;
Strong skills in working with relational databases, including SQL and/or Azure SQL, particularly for managing survey data;
Excellent communication skills, with a high degree of efficiency and adaptability;
Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage multiple tasks;
Strong attention to detail, commitment to data quality, and ability to meet tight deadlines; and,
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with a creative approach to data interpretation and visualization


Languages

For this position, fluency in English and Spanish is required (oral and written). Working knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, French, Chinese, and Spanish) is an advantage.

IOM‚Äôs official languages are English, French and Spanish. All staff members are required to be fluent in one of the the three languages.

Proficiency of language(s) required will be specifically evaluated during the selection process, which may include written and/or oral assessments

Note

Eligibility and Selection

In general, the Internship Programme aims at attracting talented students and graduates who:


have a specific interest in, or whose studies have covered, areas relevant to IOM programmes and activities;
are holding a scholarship for internship placements in international organizations and/or for whom internship is required to complete their studies; or
are sponsored by governmental/non governmental institutions and/or academia to work in specific areas relevant to both IOM and the sponsor.
are either enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor‚Äôs level or equivalent) or have graduated in the last 12 months.
are between 20 and 36 years of age.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and additional enquiries will only be addressed if the candidate is shortlisted.
Depending on experience and location, IOM provides a small monthly stipend to help offset costs.
Please consider the cost of living in the duty station prior to applying.


Required Competencies

IOM‚Äôs competency framework can be found at this link Competencies will be assessed during the selection process.

Values - all IOM staff members must abide by and demonstrate these values:


Inclusion and respect for diversity: Respects and promotes individual and cultural differences. Encourages diversity and inclusion.
Integrity and transparency: Maintains high ethical standards and acts in a manner consistent with organizational principles/rules and standards of conduct.
Professionalism: Demonstrates ability to work in a composed, competent and committed manner and exercises careful judgment in meeting day-to-day challenges.
Courage: Demonstrates willingness to take a stand on issues of importance.
Empathy: Shows compassion for others, makes people feel safe, respected and fairly treated.


Core Competencies ‚Äì behavioural indicators


Teamwork: Develops and promotes effective collaboration within and across units to achieve shared goals and optimize results.
Delivering results: Produces and delivers quality results in a service-oriented and timely manner. Is action oriented and committed to achieving agreed outcomes.
Managing and sharing knowledge: Continuously seeks to learn, share knowledge and innovate.
Accountability: Takes ownership for achieving the Organization‚Äôs priorities and assumes responsibility for own actions and delegated work.
Communication: Encourages and contributes to clear and open communication. Explains complex matters in an informative, inspiring and motivational way.


How to apply

To apply, interested applicants are invited to submit their applications HERE via the IOM Career Gateways by 11 September 2025.

  • Visualizing data, designing, and creating reports for accessibility in compliance with the DTM standards

Teamwork

  • Provide support to ensure standards in published DTM data on IOM websites, primarily displacement.iom.int, but may include any other portal as required by operations and global developments.
  • Implement data quality control mechanisms for DTM operations worldwide as set by the global standard.
  • Contribute to the implementation and roll out of responsible data mechanisms in DTM implementation worldwide. This includes the aspect of data governance, data protection, data security, and ethics in the collection and use of DTM data.
  • Support the development and adaptation of standard operating procedures for DTM field data collection and management.
  • Support the implementation of global DTM survey, tracking system for DTM operations worldwide, as well as addressing queries on data collected by DTM field operations, based on data consolidated in the Central Data Warehouse and any other databases available.
  • Support the development and implementation of Kobo forms to support DTM field operations worldwide.
  • Perform any other tasks as assigned.

Training Components and Learning Elements

  • Gain a thorough understanding of DTM methodologies, forms development and data management at DTM.
  • Develop technical knowledge of DTM data quality standards and tools used to support DTM operations at global, regional and country levels.
  • Gain a good understanding of humanitarian data collection and the use of data collection, management and analysis tools in the context of emergencies.
  • Develop communication skills to analyze, report and present on status, challenges and solutions related to data collection and management at country level.

Qualifications

Education

  • Pursuing degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Analytics or related field; with two years of relevant professional experience. Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured.

Accredited Universities are those listed in the UNESCO World Higher Education Database.

Experience

  • Knowledge of databases management, querying, quality assurance and control systems. Additional work experience is an advantage;
  • Experience in compiling, collecting, and analyzing data from different sources, structured and unstructured;
  • Experience in the development and implementation of the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) or similar assessment and information management activities; and,
  • Experience in building interactive dashboards using Microsoft Power BI and/or Tableau is preferred.

Skills

  • Good data visualization skills in HTML5 or JavaScript environments; experience with AngularJS, NodeJS, or D3 is a plus;
  • Valued proficiency in using two or more of the following tools: XLS forms for ODK or Kobo, Microsoft Access, Python, Stata, or R;
  • Strong skills in working with relational databases, including SQL and/or Azure SQL, particularly for managing survey data;
  • Excellent communication skills, with a high degree of efficiency and adaptability;
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage multiple tasks;
  • Strong attention to detail, commitment to data quality, and ability to meet tight deadlines; and,
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with a creative approach to data interpretation and visualization

Languages

For this position, fluency in English and Spanish is required (oral and written). Working knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, French, Chinese, and Spanish) is an advantage.

IOM‚Äôs official languages are English, French and Spanish. All staff members are required to be fluent in one of the the three languages.

Proficiency of language(s) required will be specifically evaluated during the selection process, which may include written and/or oral assessments

Note

Eligibility and Selection

In general, the Internship Programme aims at attracting talented students and graduates who:

  • have a specific interest in, or whose studies have covered, areas relevant to IOM programmes and activities;
  • are holding a scholarship for internship placements in international organizations and/or for whom internship is required to complete their studies; or
  • are sponsored by governmental/non governmental institutions and/or academia to work in specific areas relevant to both IOM and the sponsor.
  • are either enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor‚Äôs level or equivalent) or have graduated in the last 12 months.
  • are between 20 and 36 years of age.
  • Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and additional enquiries will only be addressed if the candidate is shortlisted.
  • Depending on experience and location, IOM provides a small monthly stipend to help offset costs.
  • Please consider the cost of living in the duty station prior to applying.

Required Competencies

IOM‚Äôs competency framework can be found at this link Competencies will be assessed during the selection process.

Values - all IOM staff members must abide by and demonstrate these values:

  • Inclusion and respect for diversity: Respects and promotes individual and cultural differences. Encourages diversity and inclusion.
  • Integrity and transparency: Maintains high ethical standards and acts in a manner consistent with organizational principles/rules and standards of conduct.
  • Professionalism: Demonstrates ability to work in a composed, competent and committed manner and exercises careful judgment in meeting day-to-day challenges.
  • Courage: Demonstrates willingness to take a stand on issues of importance.
  • Empathy: Shows compassion for others, makes people feel safe, respected and fairly treated.

Core Competencies ‚Äì behavioural indicators

  • Teamwork: Develops and promotes effective collaboration within and across units to achieve shared goals and optimize results.
  • Delivering results: Produces and delivers quality results in a service-oriented and timely manner. Is action oriented and committed to achieving agreed outcomes.
  • Managing and sharing knowledge: Continuously seeks to learn, share knowledge and innovate.
  • Accountability: Takes ownership for achieving the Organization‚Äôs priorities and assumes responsibility for own actions and delegated work.
  • Communication: Encourages and contributes to clear and open communication. Explains complex matters in an informative, inspiring and motivational way.

How to apply

To apply, interested applicants are invited to submit their applications HERE via the IOM Career Gateways by 11 September 2025.

Job details

  • Switzerland

City Geneva Source

  • International Organization for Migration

Type

  • Internship

Career category

  • Information Management

Years of experience

  • 0-2 years

Themes

  • Gender
  • Health

Title: Technical Assistant (m/w/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Die Syngenta Group, ein weltweit f√ºhrendes Unternehmen in der Agrartechnologie und Innovation, besch√§ftigt 60.000 Menschen in √ºber 100 L√§ndern, um die Landwirtschaft durch ma√ügeschneiderte L√∂sungen f√ºr Landwirte, die Gesellschaft und unseren Planeten zu transformieren. Unser vielf√§ltiges Portfolio umfasst Saatgut, Pflanzenschutz, Ern√§hrungsprodukte, agronomische L√∂sungen und digitale Dienstleistungen, die alle darauf ausgerichtet sind, Landwirten bei der Produktion gesunder Nahrungsmittel, Futtermittel, Fasern und Kraftstoffe zu helfen und dabei nat√ºrliche Ressourcen zu schonen und die Umwelt zu sch√ºtzen. Unsere Mission ist es, kritische Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und die Ern√§hrungssicherheit durch nachhaltige Praktiken und hochmoderne L√∂sungen anzugehen und gleichzeitig die Ressourcen des Planeten zu sch√ºtzen.

Syngenta Crop Protection, die gr√∂√üte Gesch√§ftseinheit der Syngenta Group, ist f√ºhrend in nachhaltigen Landwirtschaftsl√∂sungen und bietet innovative Produkte an, um Pflanzen von der Aussaat bis zur Ernte gesund zu erhalten und gleichzeitig die Umweltauswirkungen zu minimieren.

Syngenta wurde vom Science Magazine als Top-Arbeitgeber eingestuft und alle Schweizer Standorte wurden mit dem Label "Friendly Work Space" ausgezeichnet: Lesen Sie hier mehr dar√ºber: https://friendlyworkspace.ch/de/das-label/das-sind-die-label-friendly-work-space-betriebe

Stellenbeschreibung

Koordinieren aller technischen Aktivit√§ten im Zusammenhang mit einer oder mehreren Produktionslinien und Bereitstellen von technischem Fachwissen zu aktuellen Fragen, zum Beispiel f√ºr die Identifizierung und Umsetzung von Initiativen zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung.

Einbringen von Anlagenwissen, um w√§hrend des Standortauswahlprozesses die besten Optionen zu ermitteln (Senkung der Investitionskosten f√ºr Projekte) und Fungieren als Schl√ºsselmitglied des Projektteams f√ºr die Einf√ºhrung neuer Prozesse als Vertreter des Herstellers und zuk√ºnftigen Benutzers.

HSEQ (Health, Safety, Environment, Quality)


Ordnungsgem√§√üer Betrieb einer oder mehrerer Produktionsanlagen in √úbereinstimmung mit den geltenden HSEQ-Regeln und -Standards.
Unterst√ºtzung eines hohen HSEQ-Standards f√ºr die Dokumentation gem√§√ü internen und externen Richtlinien.
Beitrag zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung der Standards und Prozesse des Betriebs (HSEQ, OPEX).
Proaktives Teilen von umfangreichem technischem Fachwissen mit dem Team und Teilnahme an PRAs und WRAs bei Bedarf.


Produktionsunterst√ºtzung


Ansprechpartner und Know-How-Tr√§ger f√ºr fachspezifische Prozessbelange
Nutzen von umfangreichem technischem Fachwissen und effektiver Zusammenarbeit mit Standortsupport-Diensten (z.B. Engineering, Process Technology, QC, getec) bei Probleml√∂sung und Prozessverbesserungen.
Initiierung, Implementierung und Dokumentation kontinuierlicher Prozessverbesserungen in der Produktion; Koordination von Produktionsversuchen zur Unterst√ºtzung von Lernkurven, Initiativen zur Kapazit√§tssteigerung und Troubleshooting.
Unterst√ºtzung des Produktionschemikers bei der Instruktion der Betriebsmitarbeiter vor Kampagnenbeginn.
Beaufsichtigung eines Teams aus mehreren Betriebsmitarbeitern bei der Anlagenreinigung vor und nach der Kampagne, um die Verf√ºgbarkeit der Anlagen gem√§√ü dem festgelegten Zeitplan zu gew√§hrleisten.
Erstellung oder Unterst√ºtzung bei der Erstellung von Dokumenten (z.B. Betriebsvorschrift, Reinigungsvorschrift, Arbeitsanweisungen, Checklisten, Risikoanalysen).
Verantwortung f√ºr die Erstellung und Verbesserung der Produktions- und Reinigungsrezepte im Prozessleitsystem (DeltaV).
Beitragen zu den Studien und Arbeiten f√ºr die Einf√ºhrung neuer Produkte (Standortkalkulation, isometrische Validierung, Bereitstellung der Anlagen f√ºr das Projekt) als Teil des Projektteams und des Inbetriebnahmeteams.
Koordination der Versorgung mit Rohstoffen, Verpackungen, Verbrauchsmaterialien sowie der Deklaration und des Versands der Produkte (Zwischenprodukte und Wirkstoffe) in √úbereinstimmung mit dem Produktionsplan zusammen mit Planung und Logistik


Qualifikationen


Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse von Anlagen und Verfahren (Technik, R+I Schema, Chemische Prozesse). Mindestens 10 Jahre Erfahung in der chemischen Produktion als Chemikant, Chemie- und Pharmatechnologe, Schichtleiter, Prozessassistent oder in einer vergleichbaren Rolle.
Gute Kenntnis der HSEQ-Standards in der chemischen Produktion
Gute Kenntnisse in der Automation von chemischen Prozessen (Erfahrung mit Produktionsrezepten im DeltaV von Vorteil)
Gutes Verst√§ndnis der Grundlagen und Grenzen der verschiedenen vor Ort angewandten Risikoanalysen (Prozessrisikoanalyse, Arbeitsbereichanalyse, Arbeitsgenehmigung, Management of Change).
Gute allgemeine Kenntnisse √ºber finanzielle Aspekte einer chemischen Anlage, kontinuierliche Verbesserung und √Ñnderungsmanagement
Sehr gutes Deutsch in Wort und Schrift erforderlich; Englisch- oder Franz√∂sischkenntnisse von Vorteil
Beherrschung g√§ngiger Computerprogramme (Office, Visio). SAP Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil.
F√§higkeit, technische und betriebliche Probleme auf strukturierte Weise zu l√∂sen
Demonstrierte F√§higkeiten zur Mitarbeiterf√ºhrung von Vorteil
F√§higkeit, sich in einem sich st√§ndig ver√§ndernden Umfeld weiterzuentwickeln und schnell auf Notsituationen zu reagieren.
F√§higkeit, mehrere Aktivit√§ten gleichzeitig zu verwalten.
Fokus auf Ergebnisse und Kundenzufriedenheit


Zus√§tzliche Informationen


Wir bieten eine Position, die zu wertvoller und wirkungsvoller Arbeit in einem anregenden und internationalen Umfeld beitr√§gt.
Flexible Arbeitsregelungen und ein Umfeld mit offener Kultur und vielf√§ltiger Belegschaft
Mit Ihrer Arbeit k√∂nnen Sie einen wichtigen Betrag zur Ern√§hrungssicherheit der Menschen leisten -> #bringingplantpotentialtolife
Wir bieten ein offenes und angenehmes Arbeitsklima
Wir respektieren uns und arbeiten zusammen auf Augenh√∂he
Exklusive Rabatte und Verg√ºnstigungen f√ºr Mitarbeitende


F√ºhlen Sie sich angesprochen? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre komplette Onlinebewerbung inklusive Lebenslaufs, Anschreiben, Diplome und Zeugnisse.

Syngenta ist ein Arbeitgeber f√ºr Chancengleichheit und diskriminiert nicht bei Recruitment, Einstellung, Ausbildung, Bef√∂rderung oder anderen Besch√§ftigungspraktiken aus Gr√ºnden der Rasse, der Hautfarbe, der Religion, des Geschlechts, der nationalen Herkunft, des Alters, der sexuellen Orientierung, des Familienstandes oder des Veteranenstatus, der Behinderung oder jedes anderen gesetzlich gesch√ºtzten Status.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Software Developer (Off-Car Systems) Graduate
Description:
Join the Audi F1 Project - Shape the Future of Motorsport!

Welcome to the Audi F1 Project.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

Audi will be competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship from 2026. The new team has three locations. The Sauber Group's Formula 1 factory in Hinwil (Switzerland) is known for its innovative technologies and passion for racing. Audi's Motorsport Competence Center in Neuburg (Germany) is considered one of the most modern of its kind in Europe. We have recently opened Sauber Motorsport Technology Center in the UK. Our Power Unit comes from Neuburg, while Hinwil is responsible for the development of the chassis and race operations with support from the UK.‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

We are now opening applications for our inaugural Graduate Programme. In your graduate role, you will contribute directly to live projects, gaining hands-on experience from day one.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Continuous improvement is at the core of what we do. You will be encouraged to adapt and innovate, strengthening your skills and developing a growth mindset. Clear and effective communication, as well as constructive feedback, will be essential in helping you collaborate across teams. You will share knowledge openly and learn from the experience of your teammates. And we place great emphasis on ownership: you will take responsibility for your work, make informed decisions and understand how your contributions shape the wider team's success.

Your mission

As a graduate member of the Off-Car Systems team, you‚Äôll focus on developing and maintaining software tools that ensure high-quality data flows seamlessly from the car to engineers and analysts. You‚Äôll collaborate with performance, control systems, electronics, and data analysis teams to guarantee timely and reliable access to critical information. Your responsibilities include developing and testing software applications, managing data pipelines, and supporting system integration and troubleshooting. This role gives you the chance to work with cutting-edge software infrastructure, learn from experienced engineers across multiple disciplines, and make a direct impact on race performance in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

Key Responsibilities


Software Development and Maintenance
Design, develop, and maintain off-car systems software tools and applications.
Ensure software reliability and usability for engineers accessing car data.
Contribute to automated data processing pipelines and quality control systems.
Data Management and Analysis
Support the collection, delivery, storage, and processing of telemetry data.
Assist in validating and troubleshooting data streams from the car to end users.
Integration and Reliability
Participate in root cause analysis of software and data issues.
Propose improvements to software tools, workflows, and data infrastructure.

Your profile

Required Qualifications


A university degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related field.
Strong programming skills, particularly in Python, C++, C#, or MATLAB.
Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles.
Familiarity with database systems and data pipelines.
Strong mathematical and data analysis skills.


Personal Attributes


Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Creative and adaptable approach to problem-solving, with the ability to quickly develop solutions to complex challenges.
Show more
HTML:
Join the Audi F1 Project - Shape the Future of Motorsport!

Welcome to the Audi F1 Project.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

Audi will be competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship from 2026. The new team has three locations. The Sauber Group's Formula 1 factory in Hinwil (Switzerland) is known for its innovative technologies and passion for racing. Audi's Motorsport Competence Center in Neuburg (Germany) is considered one of the most modern of its kind in Europe. We have recently opened Sauber Motorsport Technology Center in the UK. Our Power Unit comes from Neuburg, while Hinwil is responsible for the development of the chassis and race operations with support from the UK.‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

We are now opening applications for our inaugural Graduate Programme. In your graduate role, you will contribute directly to live projects, gaining hands-on experience from day one.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Continuous improvement is at the core of what we do. You will be encouraged to adapt and innovate, strengthening your skills and developing a growth mindset. Clear and effective communication, as well as constructive feedback, will be essential in helping you collaborate across teams. You will share knowledge openly and learn from the experience of your teammates. And we place great emphasis on ownership: you will take responsibility for your work, make informed decisions and understand how your contributions shape the wider team's success.

Your mission

As a graduate member of the Off-Car Systems team, you‚Äôll focus on developing and maintaining software tools that ensure high-quality data flows seamlessly from the car to engineers and analysts. You‚Äôll collaborate with performance, control systems, electronics, and data analysis teams to guarantee timely and reliable access to critical information. Your responsibilities include developing and testing software applications, managing data pipelines, and supporting system integration and troubleshooting. This role gives you the chance to work with cutting-edge software infrastructure, learn from experienced engineers across multiple disciplines, and make a direct impact on race performance in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Software Development and Maintenance
    • Design, develop, and maintain off-car systems software tools and applications.
    • Ensure software reliability and usability for engineers accessing car data.
    • Contribute to automated data processing pipelines and quality control systems.
  • Data Management and Analysis
    • Support the collection, delivery, storage, and processing of telemetry data.
    • Assist in validating and troubleshooting data streams from the car to end users.
  • Integration and Reliability
    • Participate in root cause analysis of software and data issues.
    • Propose improvements to software tools, workflows, and data infrastructure.
Your profile

Required Qualifications

  • A university degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related field.
  • Strong programming skills, particularly in Python, C++, C#, or MATLAB.
  • Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles.
  • Familiarity with database systems and data pipelines.
  • Strong mathematical and data analysis skills.

Personal Attributes

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Creative and adaptable approach to problem-solving, with the ability to quickly develop solutions to complex challenges.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description

CENTEGIX¬Æ is the industry leader in wearable safety technology for healthcare, education, government, and commercial workplaces with over 700,000 badges in use. The cloud-based CENTEGIX Safety Platform‚Ñ¢ initiates the fastest response time for emergencies, from the everyday to the extreme. Leaders in over 15,000 locations nationwide trust CENTEGIX's innovative safety solutions to empower and protect people (every day).

Purpose

We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our Software Development team. You will maintain and improve our product data pipeline, help the team analyze data, enforce data hygiene, and implement best practices of data governance or our product data.

Reliable, high quality data is essential for sound decisions and accurate forecasts. As part of the data engineering domain, the Data Engineer ensures trusted product data reaches the right people across the organization, from Customer Service and Product to Operations, so we deliver a high quality customer experience.

Position Responsibilities


Building, maintaining, monitoring, troubleshooting, and improving data pipelines using a variety of ETL tools
Identifying and addressing data consistency and integrity issues
Completing data change requests where self-service options do not exist
Understanding our product, its data stores, and data pipelines to assist others in answering questions
Understanding and enforcing data governance policies
Leading the implementation of small projects
Supporting junior team members when appropriate
Communicating effectively with cross-functional team members
Creating and maintaining data domain documentation as needed


Requirements


1-3 years experience in data engineering or data analyst roles
Experience with ETL processes and tools
Proficiency with SQL
Proficiency with cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks, BigQuery)
Proficiency with a variety of database products (e.g., MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Redis)
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure)
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and business processes
(Bonus) Familiarity with Python


What‚Äôs in it for you?


Remote first work environment; we offer workplace flexibility
Participation in company wide discretionary bonus (2026 eligible)
15 days paid time off(prorated)
11 paid holidays
Monthly device(s) reimbursement
Up to $2500/year reimbursement for eligible education expenses
We offer a range of Healthcare plans to meet your needs (medical, dental, vision)
401(k) Plan with 4% employer contribution to help you plan for the future
Employee Referral Bonus
Charitable Program Match


CENTEGIX is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at CENTEGIX are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Database Administrator - Cloud migration
Description:
We are looking for a




DBA Consultant - Cloud Migration for our Zurich based client in the Banking sector.




Your tasks:

‚Ä¢ Automate the deployment of database modules using modern infrastructure-as-code tools

‚Ä¢ Work collaboratively with DevOps and infrastructure teams to ensure smooth deployment pipelines

‚Ä¢ Participate in the transition to a scalable cloud-based environment

‚Ä¢ Apply best practices in scripting and automation for enterprise database solutions




Your experience/knowledge:

‚Ä¢ Strong experience with Oracle databases

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Ansible and Terraform

‚Ä¢ Hands-on knowledge of Git for version control

‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of deployment automation and DevOps methodologies




Your soft skills:

‚Ä¢ Excellent comprehension skills with attention to detail

‚Ä¢ A high degree of self-organisation and time management

‚Ä¢ Analytical and solution-orientated thinking.

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.



Qualification Path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
  • Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: AI & Software Internship
Description:
At Neurosoft Bioelectronics, we are building implantable brain-computer interfaces (iBCIs) aimed at addressing severe neurological conditions, leveraging novel materials designed to enhance long-term functionality within the human body. Despite advancements in our understanding of neuronal activity, decoding brain signals in a clear and reliable way remains a complex challenge.




We have gathered specific datasets of brain activity recorded from animal models, and more recently, from human subjects using our iBCIs. To advance our research, we are investigating how advanced artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, including foundation models across various modalities, can be used to improve decoding of these neuronal signals.




We are looking to test various strategies using AI foundation models to decode brain activity. This project will span over a minimum of 6 months and will involve the following steps:





Data and meta-data curation, preparation, and formatting to match models‚Äô inputs ‚Äî this will be done in-house at Neurosoft Bioelectronics based at Campus Biotech, in Geneva, Switzerland (months 1‚Äì2)


Development and tuning of a large-scale neuronal decoding model that can effectively combine brain datasets from different sources ‚Äî in collaboration with an external partner institution (months 2‚Äì6)


Model testing, fine-tuning, and decoding of brain data (months 5‚Äì6)



Tasks


We are looking for a motivated individual currently enrolled in a MSc study program at EPFL (or at an equivalent institution) willing to carry out a full-time 6-month unpaid internship at Neurosoft Bioelectronics. The project could then be extended depending on available funding.


Requirements


Education and experience: Ongoing MSc studies (preferably prior to MSc thesis) in one of the Neuro-X laboratories or within another closely related EPFL laboratory.




Specific skills:





Strong experience with AI models (e.g., adaptive transformers) and/or currently attending specific advanced machine learning courses


Background in basic human neuroscience and/or willingness to learn about auditory neuroscience


Ease & experience with code or data handling tools (e.g., python, MATLAB, ‚Ä¶)


Ease & experience with machine learning and deep learning models and tools (e.g., transformer architecture, deep learning models, CNNs, ‚Ä¶)


Willingness to collaborate with students and supervisors from partner institution outside of EPFL


Good communication skills and language level (at least C1) in English, French is a plus


Willingness to contribute to a fast-paced start-up environment



Benefits


The full-time 6-month internship will start in mid-September 2025, according to the semester's calendar.




Please include the following elements in your application compiled as a single PDF file:





Curriculum vitae (with academic transcripts/grades and attended courses)


A short motivation statement (max. one page), incl. a description of your career goals


The phone and/or email contact of at least two references.





Ready to contribute to groundbreaking medical device projects? If you believe you have the skills and enthusiasm we‚Äôre looking for, please apply. Qualified candidates will be contacted to arrange an introductory online interview. Join us on our journey to advance neurotechnology!

Title: Data Specialist ‚Äì CDO Global Black Belt
Description:
Microsoft‚Äôs Commercial Solution Area (CSA) sets the sales strategy, leads technical sales, and operations as a hub for the Commercial Solution Areas and Support Services that power the Microsoft Cloud. Data & Analytics is a growth opportunity for Microsoft Azure, as well as its partners and customers. It includes a rich portfolio of products providing unified Data Platform supporting customers‚Äô Data needs in the era and AI.

The Azure Global Black Belt (GBB) Cloud & AI Data Specialist is a pivotal role in building trust with the Chief Data Officers (CDOs) of our customers, guiding them to build the Data Foundations for their companies‚Äô AI Transformation and influencing them to standardize on the Microsoft Intelligent Data platform. This role is crucial for driving the adoption of Azure Data & AI Services, with a particular focus on the MACC (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment) accounts.

The role engages with CDOs of our largest accounts and accounts in complex competitive situations, documenting best practices and learnings. The role also involves guiding the broader field on the winning formulas for successful CDO engagements.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Accelerate Data & AI growth while influencing Product Excellence and Go-To-Market with the insights and experiences from these engagements.


Strategic Relationships: Establish trusted advisor relationships with senior business and technology executives (CDO, CIO, CISO, CTO) in top accounts by consistently delivering value through Azure-led innovation, while amplifying Microsoft‚Äôs thought leadership by actively shaping and participating in CDO community forums, executive panels, and strategic storytelling platforms.
Drive Data & AI Platform Standardization:‚ÄØInfluence CDOs to standardize on the Microsoft Data & AI platforms end-to-end, across their Analytics platform, Data Governance, and Databases to support their companies‚Äô AI transformation.
Accelerate Azure Data Services Growth:‚ÄØDrive the increase of Azure Data Services share in key accounts, with a focus on MACC accounts. Key outcome: Increase ADS (Azure Data Services) share of ACR (Azure Consumed Revenue) in MACC agreements / MACC accounts, win new MACCs (Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitments).
Remove blockers and accelerate sales: Identify and resolve roadblocks that may hinder customer progress, bring values into deal strategy to assist sellers with deep expertise in top partner offerings globally, capacity and pricing/SKU/model, use case scenarios, process, business value articulation for assigned specialization area.
Win Over Competitors & Business Commitment: Expert in compete coaching against major Public Cloud Hyper Scalers competitors by defining winning competitive strategies (win back, surround), demonstrating superior solutions and securing business commitment.
Incubation to Mainstream: Spot repeatable patterns in sales motions (e.g., commercial constructs, customer scenarios) and scale them across the field.
Sales Strategy Feedback Loop: Working with Go-To-Market team to capture insights from customer engagements and field feedback to identify sales patterns, blockers, and opportunities. Share these insights with MCAPS to help shape better sales strategies that continuously meet customer needs and field realities.
Knowledge Transfer to Sales Roles:‚ÄØWork with enablement team as a scale mechanism to skill specialist, specialist managers, and sales leaders through deal coaching, structured knowledge sharing, and training.
Thought Leadership:‚ÄØBe a leading industry expert and drive awareness and adoption through speaking at events, publishing articles, and sharing best practices.


Key Outcomes


Increase ADS share of ACR in MACC agreements / MACC accounts.
Enhanced consistency and effectiveness in CDO engagements across the timezone.
Documented best practices and winning formulas for CDO engagements.
Successful execution of Data & AI solution plays, driving business growth and customer success.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications (RQs/MQs):


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration,
OR related field AND growing experience in technology-related sales or account management;
OR highly experienced in technology-related sales or account management
Significant experience leading the sales of large cloud engagements, especially those involving Data, Analytics and AI solutions to large/global enterprise customers.

Additional Or Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Sales Account Planning and Management: Strong and disciplined pipeline management, identification and analysis of customer usage trends, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation experience, understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.
Executive Presence: Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the business value and cost savings of the solution to the customer‚Äôs overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
Collaborative: Orchestrate and influence virtual sales/technical/support/partner teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead virtual teams through influence.
Consumption Business Strategy / Project Management: Experience leveraging cloud adoption methodologies and frameworks to structure application migration projects.
Deep understanding of the Microsoft Data platform and Azure Data and AI Services.
Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of enterprise software solutions and cloud & AI competitor landscape including AWS and GCP.
Microsoft Partners: Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.

For Austria Only: The salary for this role is starting from EURO 182,600 per annum depending on experience.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Internship, Data Insights (Central Operations)
Description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world‚Äôs largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We‚Äôre also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that‚Äôs built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun ‚Äì where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

This role will be based in S√£o Paulo.

At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.

Please submit your application in English.

As a Data Insights Intern in Central Operations, you‚Äôll apply what you‚Äôre learning in the classroom to real operational problems. You‚Äôll help build and maintain analytics assets, improve data quality and governance, and create lightweight automations that make our workflows faster and more reliable. You‚Äôll own portions of work end-to-end, collaborate across teams, and present your findings to stakeholders.

What you‚Äôll do:


Reporting & dashboards: support the creation, iteration, and delivery of recurring reports and dashboards that guide operational decisions.
Data quality & governance: assist with data cleaning, documentation, and compliance activities to ensure high quality, trustworthy datasets.
Workflow automation: contribute to small automations that reduce manual steps, improve SLAs, and standardize processes.
Business analysis: run ad hoc analyses to answer well scoped questions, quantify impact, and surface actionable insights for partners.
Risk & compliance support: help investigate issues by compiling data, performing checks, and summarizing findings as needed.
Communication: share progress and recommendations in team meetings and leadership forums; incorporate feedback and iterate quickly.



What you‚Äôll learn


How to turn raw data into stakeholder ready insights using BI tools.
How to design lightweight automations that remove toil and drive consistency.
How data governance practices keep analytics environments compliant and reliable.
How to communicate technical findings clearly and persuasively to nontechnical audiences.



Qualifications

Basic‚ÄâQualifications:


Enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Engineering, Math or similar courses.
Business fluency in English
Experience with Data Analysis, including advanced Excel skills and SQL skills
Available for at least 12 months of Internship



Preferred Qualifications


Experience with Power BI or Tableau for building dashboards.
Python for data wrangling/automation (e.g., pandas) is a plus.
Familiarity with issue tracking tools (e.g., Jira) and interest in process optimization.
Exposure to data catalogs/governance concepts (e.g., documentation, data quality checks).
Structured problem solving, attention to detail, and a bias for ownership on end-to-end tasks.



Suggested Skills:


Cross Function Collaboration
Problem Solving
Data Analytics‚ÄØ



Additional Information

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates

Title: Analista de Dados e Neg√≥cios SR | KFC Brasil
HTML:
1930, Kentucky. Nosso Coronel Sanders, com 40 anos de idade, come√ßa a desenvolver a receita secreta do que viria a ser o frango mais gostoso do mundo. √â de se imaginar que o sucesso viria f√°cil, n√£o? Pois n√£o veio. Passou anos dirigindo e dormindo em seu carro enquanto tentava vender a ideia de franquia de seu frango. At√© que em 1952, tudo mudou. Coronel Sanders conseguiu conquistar seu primeiro franqueado: um restaurante de estrada. E assim nascia o Kentucky Fried Chicken (KFC).

10 anos depois do primeiro restaurante, o KFC j√° tinha 600 lojas. E 60 anos depois, j√° s√£o mais de 5 mil lojas, em 120 pa√≠ses, com 14 milh√µes de clientes por dia. O que era uma receita secreta de um pequeno sonhador do Kentucky se tornou um dos maiores segredos do universo das marcas. E desse segredo, surgiu o frango mais gostoso do mundo.

Ent√£o essa hist√≥ria chegou aqui. A mesma receita, o mesmo padr√£o, mas com um tempero diferente: um jeitinho que s√≥ o nosso pa√≠s tem. Seja no atendimento, nos lan√ßamentos ou nos molhos, o KFC Brasil sempre tem uma novidade que voc√™ n√£o encontra em nenhum outro lugar do mundo. Nem mesmo em outro KFC.

Responsabilidades e atribui√ß√µes

  • Levantar e documentar requisitos funcionais e t√©cnicos com as partes interessadas chaves;
  • Participar ativamente de reuni√µes di√°rias , planejamento de sprint , refinamento e retrospectivas;
  • Define e mant√©m hist√≥ricos de usu√°rios e crit√©rios de aceita√ß√£o (JIRA, Azure DevOps e outras ferramentas);
  • Analisar e transformar dados de m√∫ltiplas fontes para gerar dashboards , relat√≥rios e recomenda√ß√µes;
  • Projetar e manter tabelas no Power BI e outras ferramentas de visualiza√ß√£o;
  • Coordenar com equipes de desenvolvimento, controle de qualidade e negocia√ß√£o para garantir a entrega de valor cont√≠nua;
  • identificar oportunidades de melhoria em processos de negocia√ß√£o com base na an√°lise de dados;
  • Garanta a qualidade e a trazabilidade dos dados usados nos relat√≥rios;
  • Ajudar no planejamento e gerenciamento de projetos, acompanhamento de cronogramas e relat√≥rios de avan√ßos.


Requisitos e qualifica√ß√µes

  • Ensino Superior Conclu√≠do em Engenharia Industrial, Sistemas, Estat√≠stica, Ci√™ncias da Computa√ß√£o, Economia ou √°reas correlatas;
  • Experi√™ncia comprovada em metodologias √°geis (Scrum, Kanban);
  • Conhecimento em gerenciamento de projetos (deseable certifica√ß√£o PMP, Scrum M√°ster ou similar);
  • Manejo avan√ßado de Power BI (DAX, modelado de dados, design de dashboards );
  • Conhecimento em SQL para consulta e transforma√ß√£o de dados;
  • Experi√™ncia em manejo e limpeza de dados (ETL) de fontes distintas;
  • Conhecimentos de bases de dados relacionais (SQL Server);
  • Conhecimentos b√°sicos ou intermedi√°rios em ferramentas de an√°lise como Excel avan√ßado, Python ou R (deseable);
